Reviews.Title: “More positive experience than negative”
Reviews.Author: Patrick27Limerick
Reviews.Content: Overall very pleasant stay. The majority of staff were nice (from the receptonists to the servers and the cleaning ladies), except prehaps the receptionist who checked me out. I stayed for 12 nights so i felt that i should have been asked how my stay was and should have even gotten a thank you for payment but no. The deposit they request is new to me. it wont be back in my credit card for 5 working days which is inconvenient, is this the norm in Canadian hotels? Bathroom flooded on me twice but it was dealt with switfly, except the floow was left soaking wet. Lobby nice and relaxing but i was not too enamoured with the food in the restaurant. I ate there 3 times and found the food to be nice but not worth the price. the view from the room was amazing- and bed was very confortable. Shower was nice and powerful. Kitchenette nicely stocked for my needs. Liked the pool and steam room. Cafe was ok. Very strong coffee and on my last visit had to wait 15 minutes for my coffee. Apart from these small things, really enjoyed my stay mainly due to majority of wonderful staff that i encountered. Vancouver was a special place and would love to revisit and if i do, i would stay in the hotel again

Reviews.Title: “would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Terry S
Reviews.Content: clean, centrally located and "very" friendly competent staff. nice little iga market just two blocks down for a grocery run and close to a couple of beer and wine/liquor stores if you are on foot. wouldn't hesitate to book there again! you get the very pleasant spa aroma when entering the lobby which was nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, close to nightlife and downtown”
Reviews.Author: carlbrochu
Reviews.Content: Great spot to stay overnight in Vancouver. We had stayed here before and had gotten a double queen room in the lower floors. We were happy to ask for a king sized bed as it was on the higher floor and the room itself felt newer. The exterior noise was also non-existant. The lower level will get noise from the nearby hospital at any time of the night. Clean, roomy, fridge in the room, coffee and coffee maker. Pool is al the way on L2 and the card we were given did open the door. Anyway, the pool is small and kinda dark as it is in the subbasement. Parking is 17$ a day. Their brunch is good but somewhat pricey. No late checkout makes it a bit harder for the night owls

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Li4SouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vancouver. Not knowing the city or where to stay, one always wonder what to expect... We were not dissappointed. The front desk is very helpful and friendly The rooms are huge and clean, with a kitchentte in the room. The location is perfect - we walked to the supermarket, bought some food and ate in the room. There are also good shopping stores close to the hotel. Would definetely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: blightnight
Reviews.Content: I wasnt going to bother reviewing as all said here is what i would like to say. Anyway the more the merrier i reckon so here goes. Plus sides: I had two rooms as i had a problem with my toilet (things Happen) Both rooms were very clean and spacious and exactly as described. Maid service was spot on. If not a bit overkeen. Desk service was perfect. Friendly, accomodating and Knowledgeable. I saw quite a few on the desk in my stay as i was around at all times. All were 5 star. I used them for as much planning of my stay as i could and they were very happy to help. When a porter needed to come up he was there in an instant. The Spa and Restaurant were perfect, no complaints. I never used the coffee shop. Pool was clean and comfortable. You can use the YMCA gym but at a cost i think. Changing facility was great. Even mouthwash if you want it. Minus side: The Spa and restaurant were a bit on the expensive side but i suppose you get what you pay for. There was a bare minimum of kitchen utensils in room. The steam room never seemed to steam. The first room was a bit hot at night but the air con sorted that out. Hey you can open a window to. Most hotels it seems have old windows here and you will here a bit of sound from the street. I was on 18 and 27th floor and you still hear a bit. It isnt to noisy at this location though. Its a good road as there are no clubs ect nearby. Doubt i can say more. Its perfect for walking to all areas. Im 50 and walked from there to the park, waterside, the stadium, the market, english bay to all the shops downtown, theres loads of bars and retaurants nearby look up vancouver bars and map them to the hotel. I arrived there and thought i was miles from anywhere. When you know your way around its great. I had to go to VC for a emotional family trip as well as be a tourist. The hotel made it that much easier for me and i thank all for that. It was great value but in March. I will leave it to others at a more premium time to have their say.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay for hospital visit”
Reviews.Author: leemike5ever
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while having tests done at St. Paul's hospital, which is located right next to the hotel. I was very impressed with how friendly, helpful, and professional the hotel is. We needed to add a second room for the last night of a 4 day stay and the front desk people arranged side by side rooms to accommodate us. The food was excellent at every meal and the rooms, while slightly in need of updating, were clean, quiet, and very comfortable. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “So Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Andy L
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Vancouver which is a long was from home for someone for Washington DC. I loved the city and the hotel especially because everyone was so genuinely friendly and accommodating. The rooms were large and comfortable and Harp at the front desk was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with large rooms and a view.”
Reviews.Author: Liketotravel019
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here recently and enjoyed the spacious room and view to the north (we were about 2/3 the way up the hotel). The room was comfortable with room-darkening curtains and a good bed. There was a heavy wind the night we were there so you could hear the wind whistling outside for awhile but this was not a big deal and we had a good sleep. This hotel also has many floors so getting a room with a view (west and north sides preferred) or up higher to provide more quietness is a bonus. The location is reasonable but stiill a few hundred metres from Georgia, if you are walking. We have stayed in fancier hotels but also paid a lot more money for those. Based on the price we paid, overall we felt we got good value for our stay and would not hesitate to return another time.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating staff!”
Reviews.Author: JnJmouse
Reviews.Content: Upon asking at the front desk, I was upgraded to a spacious 30th floor room with an amazing view. The owners are local, do extensive charity work and the staff speak highly of them. These are important qualities! Paul at Absolute Spa gives AMAZING therapeutic massages.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded to Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: While frequently in Vancouver, and have enjoyed many great hotels there, I had somehow forgotten what a great location the Century Plaza enjoys-so easy to get to everything downtown. The upgrades to all areas of the property in recent years are fabulus, and only topped by the excellence of the staff. Every member of this hotel staff seemed to be only concerned with making my stay awesome.. and it was. The lounge had a great selection to choose from, the restaurant food and service was excellent. An value for money... hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk the Best!”
Reviews.Author: ScottAnaheim
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located and the staff is very helpful in planning excursions and getting around town. The front desk staff went out of their way to assist in transportation/tour preparation which allowed us to get the most out of our very short stay in Vancouver. Would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Post hospital stay”
Reviews.Author: Lucciano
Reviews.Content: The Century Plaza Hotel is right next door to St Paul's Hospital in downtown Vancouver. As we live on the Sunshine Coast, a ferry ride away from the city, we stayed in the Century Plaza Hotel post surgery until it was safe to go home and I could manage to trip. This hotel offers special rates for post hospital stays or families needing to be close to loved ones in hospital. The room was huge. It was very comfortable and clean, with a full kitchen, table and chairs and sofa as well as two queen beds. The staff were helpful in every way, never failing to ask how I was doing. Great coffee shop on the main level. Spectacular city, mountain or ocean views from any almost any room.

Reviews.Title: “DOWNTOWN HAVEN”
Reviews.Author: Ross11-11
Reviews.Content: Front ofice were so friendly and helpful - upgrade to 27th floor suite, fre WiFi, vouchers for restaurant and coffee shop. Room was large, with a big comfy bed and a huge window looking over city, harbour and to Grouse Mountain. With only 2 bed lamps there was not enough light in the room. And the coffee shop has one of my favourites - Illy [reminders of Mui Ne in Vietnam etc!]. It is very central to the city, shops, eating spots, parks, Granville Island etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: johnz22
Reviews.Content: Checked in & had opportunity to see 4 rooms. Rooms do vary in size. Some studio's are bigger than others & the 1 bedroom, hide-a-bed in Living room including a full kitchen was very spacious. It had a 40" flat TV in LR but could use a 2nd phone & TV in bedroom. Studios had old TV's & renovated bathrooms, yet a good size kitchenette. On plus side rooms are accommodating, beds looked comfortable. Most rooms have upgrades although inconsistent from room to room. Free WiFi connection in Lobby otherwise $9/day. Hotel has green policy reimbursing $5/day if room service is declined (towel exchange is free). Breakfast in restaurant excellent though pricy if you include coffee (which should be included). Hotel is centralized so you can walk everywhere. Coffe shop & spa attached to hotelOn minus side, hotel has pool but no gym facility. No weekly in room WiFi discounts are offered unless you book a package. Rooms facing Burrard can be noisy since windows have only a single pane of glass. I've read several unjustified bad reviews about this hotel. My impression is that complaints may have not been addressed to the proper people. Our complaints were cordially & expediently resolved. I'd like to commend Nicci Best, front desk supervisor as truly desrving her name , she truly is the Best. Front desk Natasha & Tim are also excellent and very much customer oriented. Everyone from the concierge to the waiters were extremely friendly and accommodating

Reviews.Title: “spectacular vancouver”
Reviews.Author: cory i
Reviews.Content: over the christmas holidays my family and i stayed at the century plaza. your hotel was perfectly located downtown giving us easy access to fine shopping and fun night life within walking distance. the exectuive king room was perfect for the 4 of us. and the kitchen allowed me to save a little money on eating in. thanks to all the staff who made our stay pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Anne O
Reviews.Content: The Century Plaza was an excellent place to stay in downtown. When travelling with kids it's nice to have the kitchen in room as well as the pool and steam room in the hotel. Highly recommended for families. Great restaurant provided in-room service because the kids were sleeping and the food was fantastic! Coffee shop in lobby always great service and good food. Central location was great for visiting Vancouver - many things within walking distance or a short cab ride away so no need to rent a vehicle. Noisy only because of downtown traffic (often firetrucks or ambulances going by) but ask for upper floors helps to reduce some noise and gives better views. Awesome staff always helped to make our stay a great one with recommendations for visits, playgrounds and helped with taxis, luggage storage etc... Hotel was a little "worn" in places (eg. pool, carpets in room) but everything was clean and decent. Comfortable mattresses and nice linens - all clean. In hotel spa was great although a little pricey as spas go but all the staff was fantastic and helpful - a little relaxation goes a long way! Definitely the place to stay for family. Could use more clothing storage room - only the one dresser in the bedroom.... could maybe add a bureau in the livingroom area? Lots of room in the one bedroom suites.

Reviews.Title: “I like it”
Reviews.Author: Super_Scotty
Reviews.Content: Not the most luxurious or fancy, but clean, great location and big rooms. I am often on business and they have rooms with an office, which I really like. Walking distance to most things in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for downtown”
Reviews.Author: northernboat
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel and the rate was fantastic. Also, had a promo of free parking, which is important in downtown Vancouver. Beyond restaurant was very good and a good menu. Location is good. Yes, the hotel is older, but rooms are huge and super kitchens. No problems with anything. Room clean and good bed. Huge bathroom with counter space. Great, great staff. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Rundown”
Reviews.Author: BebitaKamloops
Reviews.Content: First I'd like to emphasize that every staff member we dealt with was wonderful. But the hotel is really rundown and shabby. The toilet leaked a lot and had to be flushed very carefully or it would not stop flushing and would make a horrendous noise until you removed the lid to the tank and tinkered inside. We were told this was not a new problem. Also, the hot air vent made a really loud sound like a gunshot every so often. During the night, this occurred every 10 minutes until 4:00 a.m. The following day the staff very kindly moved us to a new room where we did not experience these problems. The location is great and so is the staff, but until the facility is upgraded, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Nick L
Reviews.Content: We had a great visit. A big room, with 2 double beds and a kitchen - very comfortable for two of us. Good to have a pool. Reception we very friendly and accommodating. We liked the fact that we could opt out of room cleaning and have a voucher for the coffee shop. And most of all we liked the coffee shop - excellent coffee, porridge in the morning, and gelato.

Reviews.Title: “20th floor kitchen suites are awesome”
Reviews.Author: Len B
Reviews.Content: OVERALL (awesome) , 89.00/ night with a kitchen, the views are awesome , the whole experince is GREAT- FEB 2012, watch out for the $$$ on hold security dep, it wont get back on the c/card until 3 days later but thats normal :) the $20/ day food voucher is great,,, nice pool- but no hot tub :( great location too we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Good price”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: The location is pretty good, very close to the center of Vancouver downtown. But the hotel itself is aged, especially the parking structure. The staffs are friendly and helpful. Overall, it may be a good buy in its price range.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: clunyjames
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem of superb customer service with comfortable clean suites that are centrally located in the core of Vancouver. From a budget traveler that will do their own cooking and laundry to a "pampered' Spa customer this Hotel will impress with personal promt service.

Reviews.Title: “Definately would stay again and again”
Reviews.Author: Tanya S
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is excellent, from the friendly staff to the rooms and how they go out of their way to make your stay amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Maria2107
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were EXREMELY helpful in helping me find the perfect suite for my wedding night and weekend! Nicci especially was so kind and understanding, allowing me to see all the types of suites before deciding on the perfect one. In the end I booked a BEAUTIFUL honeymoon suite for an excellent price (a price that beats any comparible suite downtown by at least $50-100 or more)!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DaiWeiShi
Reviews.Content: This a very nice suites hotel, with kitchen and very good value deal including parking and breakfast. It is well located and staff was very good.

Reviews.Title: “What a warm and inviting place to stay in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: Verna Lynn K
Reviews.Content: I was worried that I didn;t have a reservation as I this was an emergency trip for my Mother. Friendly and helpful staff made me feel comfortable and at home for my 3 day stay. It was a quick walk back and forth between the hotel and St Pauls hospital visiting my Mom. Just a few minutes walk away from Great shopping also! The Beyond resteraunt and coffe shop served all my needs with wonderful food and great prices! Thank you Century Plaza! Lynn from Terrace BC

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SJS661
Reviews.Content: We thought we would give this hotel another chance having stayed here once before...how wrong we were to do so. Due to attending a hospital appointment to have surgery we had requested a quiet room. We ended up asking for a room change after the first night due to the room being very cold as there was a large hole in the wall where the pipework from the air conditoning unit went through to the balcony and had not been sealed...you could actually put your hand outside!!! The staff did relocate us and said they would inform maintenance of the issue in the room. Having been in two rooms by now we found that both rooms had a number of frustrating similarites. The heating was very hard to regulate, the bathrooms were not cleaned well including hair in the tub and dirt on the doors and sink areas!! The beds were rock hard and very uncomfortable.The baseboard heaters made the most bizarre sounds...banging and knocking at all times throughout the day and night!! The kitchens didn't have adequate utensils/cookware in either rooms and were different in both rooms and the oven door didn't even close!! Having had a room change we were very disappointed to find that none of the reception staff even bothered to ask us if everything was to our satisfaction....so much for customer service!! We had planned to stay for five nights but checked out early due to our disappointment and booked into another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to St Paul's”
Reviews.Author: OldGoat17
Reviews.Content: Room was large, clean & slightly worn. Old small TV. Worn tub. Equipped with fridge, microwave & coffee maker. Good mattresses, too large of pillows. Single pane windows. Restaurant staff very good, dinnerware & flatware very nice, food so-so, Overall, good price.....

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Karen U
Reviews.Content: The lobby was beautiful and expected the rooms to be a little nicer. They weren't bad, but a little dated. The beds were a little saggy. There was a nice pool, but no hot tub. The pool restrooms were really nice, with a steamroom in each. The staff were nice and friendly and the location was great and the price wasn't bad. Parking was convenient but tight, and a little pricey. The rooms had a lot of potential. Really large and clean, and with a little paint and updating (replace the older faucetts in the tub, change out the yellow rubber drain plug and yellowing grip matt, update the kitchen and maybe the headboards... you get the idea) But the carpet looked new. It just needs a little love and warmth added to the rooms and it could be a 4 star property.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: Edie P
Reviews.Content: The Century Plaza provides excellent, individualized service; the staff are friendly and accommodating and go the extra mile for their clientele. The suites are large, comfortable and well equipped plus the windows open for ventilation. The hotel is centrally located in downtown Vancouver beside St Paul's Hospital and offers excellent medical rates. It is close to grocery stores, drugstores and all of the downtown amenities. The North, West and East views of the city and the mountains and the ocean are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: travel-bugs122
Reviews.Content: We often stay at the Century Plaza when in Vancover. Often rates are among lowest in town and the loation is central in the downtown core. Close to grocery stores, restaurants & clubs. The one bedrrom suites offer the conveniences of a small condo. Not the fanciest rooms in town but great for the price you pay. The Friendly door staff make guests feel welcome. Enjoy the steam room and pool after a day of exploring this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Week's visit”
Reviews.Author: SueD746
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptional going above and beyond with their service, friendliness and compassion. Excellent hotel to stay at if one has to visit the St. Paul's hospital. They offer special medical rates, as well as little extra touches such as nice amenities in the rooms. Also very close to Robson and Granville, exciting areas to visit.

Reviews.Title: “night at the movies, and a good close place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Davidinbc
Reviews.Content: Service was very good and the rooms are clean and well service with mini apartments. The IGA is next store wit lots of food , especally breakfasts. Movie theatre is across the street, with lots of screens.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very care staff”
Reviews.Author: wunderland71
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Vancouver. It's within walking distance to Robson St and the Pacific Center. If you are in need of a hotel near St. Paul's Hospital it is right next door. Staff attentive. Room spacious and clean. Front desk staff friendly. Lovely products from the SPA in your room.

Reviews.Title: “front desk clerk”
Reviews.Author: Rodger B
Reviews.Content: my stay was sweet and awesome especially front desk clerk that check me in

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JennC212
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated in the center of Vancouver. I stayed here for about 4 nights. We rented a car and there is parking in the lower floors of the hotel - you have to pay for parking. There is a spa attached to the hotel so you get the spa bath products in your room. The room we got was spacious and the beds are comfortable. Service is great, they are very attentive to their guests. The room feels a little old, but otherwise was fine. There is a fridge and a microwave in the room, which makes buying food from outside and eating in easy. Breakfast at the hotel was pricey so we just bought bread and kept it in the fridge. Overall, the stay is a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “wow..great service”
Reviews.Author: ArnoldQuesnelBC
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was just great...fantastic coffee shop...don't drink the corporate coffee down the street. The thing that made me write this review was the fantastic service I received. Lost baggage especially when the delivery company loses your bag after the airline loses it is stressful. Nicci and Gerry here at the hotel took it upon themselves to track down my bag. They had to look at their security video to see that it wasn't delivered as reported and then did some detective work and phoning to make sure the bag arrived eventually. They seemed as happy and relieved as me to get it finally. Great hotel with great people.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: anniethatswho
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel over the holidays. From the moment we stepped in the door, Jerry was phenomenal. There was a large group of us staying and playing. The ladies had spa treatments and the experience was exquisite! Dinner at the restaurant was amazing, serving 16 people at one table can be a challenge at the best of times, but our server and table attendants were courteous, and efficient. The wine selection has been put together very well! The 950 square foot suite was perfect for the night. A king size bed, a lovely sitting area and a view that only can be appreciated live.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: mommycha
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is pretty centrally located downtown near many restaurants. The hotel is all suites, and there is a supermarket about 3 blocks away, which we made use of for preparing breakfasts and heating up a couple of dinner leftovers. Plus its nice to have a fridge to chill water or juice in. There is wifi for a fee; you can connect up to 2 devices at a time. The lobby is clean and modern. The rooms themselves, are a little older. There is a lot of space, and the case goods and kitchen are updated, but we had a very worn looking sofa in our room. The space seems too big for the quantity pf furniture. You can tell that that they tried, but their efforts fell a little short. This is probably the worst thing about the hotel, that the room itself is a little worn. There is no fitness center, but there are a couple of places nearby where you can purchase a day pass. There is a pool on site. It is small-ish and located in a windowless room below the lobby. This area also looks worn. In contrast, there is a fairly luxurious/spa-like locker room off of the pool w a steam room. We were traveling for leisure, so selected location and kitchen facilities over luxury of room. It was fine for our purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: My family and I had came to the Century Plaza and stayed with them for 5 days. As soon as we walked into the lobby we were all impressed by the lobby and how friendly and accommodating the staff was. We had booked for a studio room with 2 double beds but were upgraded to a one bedroom suite which was very spacious and perfect for our family. The front desk staff was awesome! The young lady Harp at the front desk was very friendly and had excellent recommendations for restaurants and outdoor activities. She always had a warm welcoming smile when talking to us and helping us get around by transit. Thank you Harp!! We ate at the restaurant one night and it was excellent. The steak was made exactly how I had wanted it! There is a iga supermarket two blocks from the hotel (which had saved us a couple bucks for breakfast) I would definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends and family and would be staying at the Century Plaza every time we come to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Staff is Rude”
Reviews.Author: Billy D
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 y/o and I checked in to our room and the toilet was overflowing. We called the front desk to send someone up to take care of it. Half hour later nothing. I called again and they finally sent someone. He plunged the toilet but when he left it still wouldn't flush. My wife called to let him know there was still a problem and Amid, the guy who was working the front desk, said, "Well, it should be working... are you sure you didn't clog it?" So we got switched to another room which we were told would be the same. It was the same layout however the bedroom didn't have a TV. The first room did. So we got a downgrade. Bummer. Oh well, the room was nice and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a long stay”
Reviews.Author: Stijn_Willems
Reviews.Content: I stayed here fro one week during december and have to say that it was a good hotel. It's not the most fancy design hotel but the room we had was large and had a small kitchen, making it perfect for a long stay! The staff was really friendly and the coffee bar was great. You need to pay extra for internet in your room but there is a good and free internet service in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “good deal booking though their website.”
Reviews.Author: K T
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night. I chose this hotel because it was close to the venue we were going to. The check-in staff were very polite and quick, even though we showed up early for check-in time. The room was clean. The soap, shampoo etc in the bathroom was nice, not cheap and gross like some hotels I've stayed at. We had coffee in the Beyond coffee shop in the morning and the staff there were friendly as well. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel to friends and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good deal, dated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gl6663
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before, great view and friendly staff. Rooms are bit dated, bit comfortable. We asked for an upper floor and they obliged. They have no gym on premises which I find odd for a downtown business class hote. They state that there are gyms close(YMCA). Everything is close by, Robson Street, Stanley Park. Would recommend this hotel for a one to two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of it...”
Reviews.Author: koniption
Reviews.Content: The Century is within walking distance to Yale Town, the Gaslight District, Granville Ave/St?, and more. The subway here is close by as well. So, love the location. Beware the valet parking. I was getting ready to drop off my keys (there's a sign on the street saying "valet parking" when a Century employee indicated to me that they do not offer valet parking. So, who was the guy who was just about to park my car? Use their self-park lot around the corner. There is a charge but has a direct elevator to the lobby. The foyer is nice and check in and staff were friendly. Nicely dressed folk were in abundance - maybe because of the attached comedy venue? The building appears to be a bit older and thus the halls in the tower were fairly skinny. Not a problem but felt a bit closed in compared to more modern hotels. On the other hand, the room was relatively spacious. Actually had a very nice view of the city. Wasn't expecting that. Took a couple nice night shots. No flat screen TV here. Windows are leaky aluminum but were not a problem for the HVAC to overcome. The Internet access was poor. Took quite a while for the WIFI to connect then performance after connecting was borderline unusable. Based on the SIP naming, I think I was between floors with routers. Internet is not free. The bathroom shampoo and such were nice. Room could have been cleaner. Couch hadn't been cleaned in a while. Corners needed vacuuming. Overall, I'd stay here again on a personal trip but not for business because of the lack of solid Internet. It was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Not spectacular but comfortable. Great location!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRainyDay
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are a bit older as is the elevator. This is not a spectacular hotel like Loden, but it is fairly comfortable. What we loved the most was the location. The staff also was very nice and apt, unlike in other places we've visited. There is a restaurant, which looked nice, although we didn't eat there, and a cafe for a quick coffee in the morning. I would recommend it for families or business travelers on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver B.C. Trip”
Reviews.Author: Habsfan51
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little older but very good. The rooms are large. As big cities go it is not expensive. Walking distance to BC place, Rogers Arena and Stranley Park. Lots of restaurants near by and very close to Robson Street. Water or mountain views available. One down side is that it is next to a hopital so did hear sirens. Second time I stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place close to everything downtown”
Reviews.Author: katrayla
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent, the room was clean, the staff were friendly and helpful.. and I would highly recommend the room service for the tired traveler who just wants a bit of peace and quiet.. the steak was the best I have had in a long.. long time.. there was a bit of horn honking in the am.. as the city came back to life,, all in all.. perfect.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place.”
Reviews.Author: falkorComoxValley_Bc
Reviews.Content: I think I've stayed here 5 times now and I really like it. I always get the one bedroom suite as I like to cook and the kitchen if fairly well equiped and I like having the extra space of a living room and balcony. I love the views of the city and the beds are so comfortable and the duvet bedding a nice touch. The organic bath products smell great, the cleaning staff if very friendly and always do my dishes even though i ask them not to. Beyond restaurant has great food and service. I haven't tried the pool yet as it wasn't until I read the in room service book that I found out about it. We went and had a look at it this visit and it appears to be very clean, a decent size, and the changing rooms are amazing with surprising amenities. I guess my one complaint is that the front desk staff can sometimes be unfriendly and I wish that the $20 restaurant voucher I recieved could've been used at anytime of the day, not just for dinner. They were not willing to change it for me. oh well. Everything else is great, especially the cheap rates. So inexpensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Superb staff!”
Reviews.Author: FitMom68
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one weekend while I was at a Conference at the Beautiful new convention center addition. The staff here were always friendly and helpful including the cleaning ladies. I felt very comfortable at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, lots of noise”
Reviews.Author: mavowilson
Reviews.Content: The central location of this hotel had advantages and disadvantages. Centrally located, it was a good base for exploring the fantastic city of Vancouver. However, it was also very noisy, with frequent sirens, all night traffic and noisy air conditioning. Rooms were very spacious, with great views of the city at night. However, furniture and decor were tired and in need of being up-dated. Staff in the restaurant were kind and courteous and the breakfasts were a highlight. The bellhop could also not have been more helpful. In contrast, we had to wait for our rooms to be cleaned, after the appointed hour of arrival, despite explaining that we been had on the move for 18 hours and my family was exhausted. We were then given an inappropriate room (double not twin for the children). I would love to visit Vancouver again but would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MHDailey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the century plaza for five days on business in a king room. The location was fantastic, staff friendly and room was great too. This is an old building but they have done a great job updating it. The room was spotless. It had a kitchenette which was handy. The bed was awesome. Very comfy. The pool was nothing fancy but it was clean and warm! Great steam room as well. Both the cafe and restaurant were excellent. I went to the comedy club one evening and I have to say, one of the better shows I have seen! They have a fantastic environment policy - if you skip housekeeping you get a $5 voucher for the cafe or restaurant. My only complaints are that the doors all slam shut which is disturbing. Also, the extras add up. Parking is expensive and so is wifi! Pros totally outweigh the cons. I will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise.”
Reviews.Author: Rod S
Reviews.Content: A nice clean and large room together with a small kitchenette. The bathroom was very modern and was kept clean for the whole time we stayed ( a week). The hotel is situated right in the middle of downtown and in walking distance of all of the main streets. One small snag is that the hotel is next to the hospital and if you choose a room on the side next to it then there is quite a lot of noise from ambulances if you have the windows open. The breakfast is quite expensive and we found a convenience store only 5 minutes walk away so we had all of our breakfasts in our room. The tourist bus stops right in front of the hotel. This is a great way to see the city and you can get on and off wherever you want. The bus comes by every half hour, the driver gives a running commentary and it costs about 35$ a day. Just one very important tip, Canada charges a value added tax on everything you buy. The shops do not show the price including tax, this applies to restaurants as well so that you always get a surprise when the bill arrives. Go to the museum by the University. It has the most fabulous collection of art etc of First Nation People. To get there by taxi costs about 30$ but we returned by bus for 5$ and it is easy to get back into the downtown. If you are going on to Vancouver Island then get a taxi just to the main bus station. You then catch a bus right through to Victoria. The bus takes about 1 hour to the ferry, then it drives onto the ferry which takes about 1& 3/4 hours through the smaller islands and you then board the bus still on the ship which then takes you to the bus station in Victoria which is right in the middle of the town.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, but no luxury”
Reviews.Author: mpgyvr
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here as a weekend getaway. I had a gift certificate for the spa, so thought I would make a weekend of it. Rooms: chose the large suite as it's seemed a very good price for the description and size. It is a HUGE room, especially for a downtown hotel, with a decent view. But it's very old, dated, and not particularly comfortable. The bed was poor and uncomfortable, the sofa old, and the carpet and decor felt like something out of the That 70's show. The windows were single pane and large, which meant there was a cold draft into the room. Facilities: The lobby, restaurant area was renovated recently and does look very nice. The spa is ok, bit small and cramped but good service. The change rooms for the pool were small and not very nice. The indoor pool is ok, but not a place I would want to hang out in for long. Staff friendly and attentive. Food: Had breakfast and dinner in the restaurant. Service was ok, food decent. Bit pricey, but not too bad. Probably won't stay again, although if they renovate the rooms and keep same price has potential to be a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Joan T
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Vancouver at 9 a.m. and went directly to the hotel hoping to leave our baggage until check in time at 3 p.m. in the afternoon......what a pleasant surprise to be told that we could go to our room immediately. We had reserved a suite and another pleasant surprise was the size of the suite....a full kitchen and living/dining area.....it was like staying in a condo for two nights. We were able to leave our baggage in storage until we were ready to leave on the last day as our train departure was 8:30 at night. The meals at the Beyond Restaurant were outstanding as well. I would highly recommend this hotel to my friends. Thanks again for a memorable visit to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: Bill_in_Kitchener
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed four nights in a King Suite at the Century Plaza and, for the price, this is a good hotel. The rooms have been updated but are a still a little bit dated-looking - nothing horrible, but the update of the lobby was much more thorough. The building itself is something like 36 years old. They offerered a breakfast and parking package for an additional $20 per night (providing breakfast for two people) I thought it was a good value just for me so for two people it is an excellent value. WIFI is not included but available for $10 per day (kind of steep, in my view, and not the fastest service.) Restaurant (Beyond) has excellent food and the chef actually knows how to cook a steak blue - bonus! I thought drinks there were pricey but I`m not all that familiar with booze prices in BC - maybe it`s all expensive. Overall, good value for the money and the staff were friendly and professional. I`ll likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice... an amazing bargain!”
Reviews.Author: alfajohn
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise - a real three/four-star hotel at bargain prices. Great service, pleasant staff, nice big suite. The whole place was clean and our rooms had been recently renovated. Even parking was a bargain compared to other Vancouver hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CanucksKickAzz
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in the Century Plaza once before and have nothing but good things to say. In fact, we booked it again for halloween weekend! Large 1br suite with everything you could need inside (except for a hot tub!) We had a great view of Burrard and the church. Loved the patio and large TV for watching the Canucks win! Seems up to date with most items, but you can't please everyone I guess. Can't beat the price for what you get. The young lady at the front desk was very helpful too (even though she was an Oilers fan) and made the experience better. Parking is the only issue I had. Even though it's on site, it should be free for hotel guests. But at only $17 it's cheaper than parking anywhere else downtown! In fact, I know that the hotel frequently checks this site, so in exchange for an awesome review, perhaps a free night on the hotel? Never hurts to ask. Would definately reccommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: dlcyh
Reviews.Content: Have not found a better hotel at this price in Vancouver....ever!

Reviews.Title: “Dream Holiday.”
Reviews.Author: foxfordcat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our dream holiday, a trip to Vancouver and a trip on the Rocky Mountaineer. We stayed at the Century Plaza Hotel in Vancouver and as this was booked by our tour operator we were a bit sceptical and didnt know what to expect. We got a very pleasant surprise when we arrived. The hotel is modern and absolutely spotless. Staff are very pleasant and nothing was too much trouble for them. Because we were staying more than 2 nights we were upgraded to a suite which included a small kitchen and lounge area. This suited us as sometimes we just like to have breakfast at our leisure and in the evenings, having been out all day, we like to relax and read, so this suited on both these aspects. I would highly recommend this hotel and if I was to return to Vancouver I would definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations”
Reviews.Author: Bangalorean4Life
Reviews.Content: Step into the lobby and you feel like you're entering a swanky hotel. step out of the elevator to your floor, and it feels like an old apartment building. the queen suite is actually the size of a 1-bedroom apartment, and felt like a mediocre-ly maintained vacation rental. It worked for the most part - has a queen bed, and a pull-out sofa bed, room to move around, but the furniture was basic and musty. Also found a couple of bugs (silverfish) on the carpet, which I quickly stubbed out before the wife saw them and freaked. Plus, there was no free wi-fi in the room (had to go down to the lobby for free wifi), which is becoming a dealbeaker these days when I look for hotels. We found a deal online, but I'm not sure I'll come back for the price I paid. It wasnt especially bad, but not great either. If all you're looking for is a place to sleep that is sort of walking distance from your downtown vancouver tourist spots, this could work for you.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Greenfinch48
Reviews.Content: Fair mid-town location, within walking distance of Museum of Anthropology (if you're interested). The rooms are generously-sized with kitchenettes etc. but let's say a bit "tired". My husband and I agreed the century plaza was OK for somewhere to lay you head for a night, but not somewhere you'd want to walk on the carpet barefoot! If we were going to Vancouver again, I think there would be better options.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: sg2ns5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights in a King Studio room on the 21st floor. Pros: - Kitchenette had a sink, mini fridge, microwave, electric kettle, tea pot, and coffee maker. We were able to prepare instant noodle and sandwiches in the room. There's a grocery store one block up the street for convenient shopping. - Our room overlooked the church next door. Nice views. - The bed felt really big and was firmer than other hotel beds I've slept in, which my back appreciated. - The room was spacious, as well as was the bathroom. I liked the large mirrors which made the room feel even bigger. - The doorman's friendly greeting when we first arrived set the tone for our stay there. Minor cons: - The TV was not well stationed. It neither faced the sofa nor the bed so you have to watch it from an angle. - We took public transportation everywhere, so while it was a walkable distance from the main transit stations, next time I would consider staying closer to the SkyTrain Stations to make it easier to get around. If you drive, then it wouldn't make a difference. - Charging $3.50 for a bottle of water is daylight robbery. A bottle of water cannot cost more than the free toiletries that are provided in the bathroom. I do not understand why hotels charge for this very basic necessity. But that's alright, we bought water from the grocery store a block away. - No free wi-fi. We were not told there was free wi-fi in the lobby. :( Overall, if you like preparing your own food and/or have a car, this is a great place to stay in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “visiting vancouver Father&Daughter”
Reviews.Author: Tony W
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Vancouver and staying at the hotel just made it all the better.The door men were very friendly and helpfull the Restaurant was great plenty of food and great service.The room was good just a problem with the toilet now and then.But other wise the view from our room was perfect..All the staff should be very pleased with them selves.Hope to visit again very soon.Hi to Dan&Stewart.Regards Tony&Kim.Newcastle Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Virtual 5 Star Service! Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: lamronby
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this very pleasant hotel about 6 weeks ago and finally found the chance to log on here and contribute. Especially since this was my second enjoyable time staying here... This property has to be the epitome of superior value for the area in which it is located. The service and attentiveness of the staff definitely rivals that of any 5 star establishment. In a nutshell, they make you feel like royalty. The location could not be better for much of what there is to do in Vancouver. Walking distance to Stanley Park and the Aquarium as well as being just blocks from top notch dining and the bustling nightlife of all age and gender persuasions. The hotel is squeaky clean. About the only negative I even heard of was that you should never leave belongings in your car when parking in the garage. The on site restaurant is decent. We had dinner there one night which was so, so. But, for breakfast, Look out! I enjoyed quite the over the top delicious Banana Bread French Toast there one morning. I'm sure you could pay more for a stay in this area. But, with this property available and the economy being for most what it is these days, I would have to ask why?

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: jimger045
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in the Century Plaza - we were there on June 22, 23, 24,25 June 2011 and again on 10th July The rooms were spacious and had a fully fitted kitchen area - a real bonus for my student son and his girlfriend who also stayed there for a few nights around the same time and could economise a little on dining out! We had breakfast every morning in the hotel restaurant. What huge portions and the porridge was particularly good. At night we dined out in the really good restaurants Vancouver has! Must mention a lovely lunch we had with a group of friends in the Waterstreet restaurant overlooking the famous clock in Gastown. The hop on and off bus stops just outside the hotel. Our first stop was the Aquarium and it was so enjoyable - a must do for any visitor. Stanley Park is a 15 or 20 walk from the hotel and well worth spending time in. My wife and others hired out bikes and I just wandered about looking at totem poles, rose gardens and good views of the city. My son and I played golf in a nice little par 3 golf course also found in the park. We took a day trip to Vancouver Island, spending some pleasant hours cruising across, walking around beautiful Victoria and visiting the beautiful Buchart gardens with its lovely delphiniums and Chinese gardens - thoroughly recommended! Granville island and its market and lovely beach walks also contributed to our enjoyment.We also visited the Capilano suspension bridge - it didn't disappoint - and Grouse mountain - also a worthwhile experience.Vancouver is such a beautiful city, so perfectly located along the seashore with the mountains visible in the distance - we would love to return sometime. When we came back to the hotel on the 10th July we were upgraded to a suite on the 27th floor, a beautiful room with a spectacular panoramic view of the city! I must also mention the foyer staff - so friendly and helpful! Altogether a really memorable experience and thoroughly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Bob S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, very friendly and helpful staff with clean good rooms. There was a kitchen provided with a sink, fridge and microwave. However, it would have helped if there was crockery, cutlery and utensils provided as without them it was a waste of time.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE!!!! and REASONABLE RATES!”
Reviews.Author: amyleigh81
Reviews.Content: great clean hotel, would definatley recommend it!!! Very central to everything! Staff were very very helpfull and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for touring Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: NIRS3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights. One night before our Alaskan cruise and three afterwards. In our three separate stays we were on different floors (15th to 18th) and all rooms were well cleaned and looked after. All had great views of the city and the sunsets were great. We were impressed with the size of each suite and the kitchen facilities including the cooking equipment. We had breakfast in our room each day enabling us to make an early start to see this beautiful City. Extra tea and coffee was provided on request. We were equally impressed with the very helpful front desk and concierge staff as they confirmed all our pre booked tours and advised us to try a couple of places to eat and the best way to see the city. The Greek restaurant on Davie Street was excellent although the portions were huge. We spent a day/night in Victoria (the Butchard Gardens were amazing) but we failed to really realise how long it would take to make the trip to Vancouver Island) but the hotel looked after our main luggage whilst we were away. The staff told us how to get the free shuttle to Capliano Suspension Bridge and Grouse Mountain and gave us vouchers which gave us a discount - great service!! Particularly helpful was a chap called Amim.(?) There was a handy Marketplace Supermarket a block or so down Burrard Street which had everything we needed. There was some noise from sirens etc but heck what do you expect we were right in the centre of downtown Vancouver - it did not disturb us! The Hop on Hop off bus was right outside the door and enabled us to get our bearings as well as providing a more in depth tour of Stanley Park - good value! We used a taxi hailed outside the door to get to the airport and again at $30 we thought this was excellent value as otherwise we would have had to take our luggage 5 blocks to the skytrain. We did quite a lot of walking and the central location of the hotel meant we were not very far from anywhere - a big plus point. We have already recommended this hotel to friends planning a similar trip.

Reviews.Title: “kitchenette was the highlight”
Reviews.Author: Seabird21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with a friend. The rooms were very spacious and it was great having a kitchenette to help save money by having a healthy breakfast like you would at home. They were probably the two highlights. It was great having a big "corner" room but the furniture was sparse and old looking and the TV archaic with terrible reception. The way it was located you could either see it from the "lounge" or from the bed but this involved rotating it in either direction. The bathroom was ok with good water pressure in the shower and enough room to feel comfortable. The kitchenette and fridge were a nice convenience. I thought the package we had included free wi-fi but it turns out this was only free in the hotel lobby. Luckily there were enough chairs around to accommodate all the hotel guests trying to check emails etc. The reception staff were not particularly helpful when I asked for advice on where to eat ... and I'd only asked them as there was no one located at the concierge area. At any rate, for a short stay it was ok but I'd probably look at staying elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: ExpatAussie3
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, good restaurant quality food, nice rooms. An old hotel that has been refurbished. My room had a small kitchen which is ideal if staying for more than a few days. Easy walk to restaurants, malls, etc. Bus service at front door. Taxis often wait at hotel. Great views from upper level rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Century Plaza for three evenings in mid-September. Location is the plus at staying at this hotel. Good access to Davie Street, Robson Street and is near the entertainment district. However, we found the hotel rather dirty, and the beds appear to be very old. I could feel the springs of the mattress on my back while sleeping. We found sesame seeds on the old, worn couch when we entered the room. The radiator on the wall was torn apart and needed to be replaced. We won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: CoachClassTraveller
Reviews.Content: Central location, excellent views from room. Comfortable room inc. kitchenette. Pleasant stay, pleasant staff. Beautiful food! The Spa was exceptionally well run, lots on off.

Reviews.Title: “Still disappointed in Century Plaza”
Reviews.Author: MightyVinyl
Reviews.Content: Having written a very negative review of this hotel last year, I decided it was time to give them another try as my current favorites (either of the Best Western properties on Granville in downtown) were booked full. Upon checkin I remembered why I used to like this hotel - nice location, beautiful lobby, and a generous room size although a bit overpriced. But when I went to log onto my computer and check email, I got a rude shock. As of Fall 2011, they now offer in-room wifi but they charge $9 for a 24 hour period! I quickly ran to the bathroom to see if their was a charge for the shower, and was relieved to find that no, showers are still free. Then I thought I best check the tv, perhaps it takes quarters now to operate it for 15 minutes? But no, it's still free as well. Thank heavens the heat and A/C were also still included in the room rates. But having to pay $9 for in-room wifi seems egregious in todays traveling climate. Although I didn't deign to pay for the privilege of checking emails in my room, I did venture down to the lobby around 9pm on Friday evening to use the free wifi there. I was surprised by how slow the connection is, which made me doubly grateful I wasn't paying $9 for the rights to be frustrated at the slow speeds. These guys might actually have a decent hotel someday if they didn't nickel and dime you at every turn.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: corkyPhoenix_Az
Reviews.Content: In preparing to go on a cruise, where the airlines cancelled our initial flight out, the staff at the hotel was so understanding. Although I gave less than 24 hours notice of not being able to spend the first night due to the airline cancelling our initial flight out, the cancellation fee was waived. The upon arriving, they generously comped us up to a 2-room suite. The staff was so accomodating to all our needs. Kudos to Tim, Jerry, and the front deskman. I have already name-dropped the hotel to several people while we were in Vancouver and on the cruise ship. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “After Cruise Central for exploring”
Reviews.Author: k_crickman
Reviews.Content: After a small cruise room this room with a kitchen and sitting area was a welcome sight. It was across the street from the Hop On Hop off buses. 10 blocks from the cruise terminals. Very helpful staff. They had free internet in the lobby. Since it has a kitchen, we walked a blocks on Davie street which had a drug store with groceries, great for getting a few snacks and breakfast items. The same area had great little neighborhood restraurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: junebaby03
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room on Trip Advisor/Expedia for $149/night which was a good rate for summer in downtown Vancouver. When we arrived we were upgraded to an executive suite on the 30th floor without even requesting it! We had a voucher for free parking from Trip Advisor, so that was another bonus! The staff were friendly and helpful and the location was ideal - very close to Robson. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “good!”
Reviews.Author: anouk1972
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a suite with separat bedroom. Nice and a lot of space. good breakfast and the personel was very helpful. Location in vancouver is very good. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: DiscoverAndEnjoy
Reviews.Content: Terrific suites. Spacious, clean, easy walking distance to core downtown (5 or 6 blocks) good section of town, competitive rates. Friendly staff but no free Internet. A Market Place a block away with great food if you want to save a few bucks. Spa services competitive for a big city but if you walk over to Granville street you can get hair and nails done for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Bob_M325
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference but the designated hotel was very expensive. This was cheaper, although not cheap. My room was very spacious and all of the facilities were in very good condition. Excellent views from the 18th floor, and very quiet at night. Location was good-an easy walk from Skytrain and midway between Robson and Davey.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms really need a desperate upgrading”
Reviews.Author: Reeny74
Reviews.Content: After entering the magnificent foyer it was a bitter dissappointment to get to our room. It was clean but during our stay we encountered a toilet cistern which flushed by itself during the night, taps which would not stop dripping, the lack of any powerpoints in the kitchen area forcing the toaster and kettle to be used in the bathroom, light coming through the splits in the curtain backings at daybreak and the sirens from the emergency ambulance services and hospital just up the road going off at all hours of the night. Would I go back there? No. Look around for somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: K M
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great staff. The executive suite that we stayed in was spacious and very nice. The cleaning staff was very helpful, friendly and accommodating. The location is ideal. Can't wait for the next occasion to return. Kim & Huon

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: L0tusBoy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a couple of days prior to taking a cruise ship to Alaska. It was a great base for exploring the city, the staff were courteous and friendly and the room excellent. We didn't eat there during the day - there's just so many great seafood places in Vancouver - but the breakfast each day was superb. All in all, this was a great start to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Yearly stay”
Reviews.Author: Wish_I_was_on_a_trip
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel every year when we visit St Paul. The price is great and the fact that it is right beside the hospital can't be beat. This year (2011) we found the staff to be wonderful. The few previous years they have been quite unfriendly and unhelpful. We will continue to stay at this hotel every year and appreciate the cleanliness and fair price of this hotel. Please note that this is an older hotel so you are going to see wear and tear. However the bathrooms are very beautiful but small in the rooms we've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Breakpoint
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights at the Century Plaza Hotel, and very comfortable in the hotel. The Century Plaza offers suites which include a small kitchenette, with fridge, microwave, coffee pot, sink and dining table. For a long stay, it was a nice convenience to be able to carry out to my room, and store leftovers. The beds are comfortable, the bathroom small, and the entire suite in need of a decorative upgrade. The hotel is conveniently located to Robson St. shopping and dining as well as Davie Village (shopping and dining). I was at the convention centre for a week, and the hotel was within walking distance, but returning is up hill. I found the prices to be a bargain compared to other properties I investigated prior to booking. I found the hotel staff to be helpful, and the restaurant good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Trust33
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the heart of downtown Vancouver within walking distance from shopping, skytrain, all types of food, etc. The room itself was spacious and extremely comfortable. While the staff was very friendly, we found them to lack some knowledge on logistics within the city. For example, no one on the staff told us there was free shuttle service to locations such as Capilano Suspension Bridge and Grouse Mountain. You do need to do some research in order to figure out the most efficient way to get around the city. One unfortunate aspect about the hotel is that there is no fitness room and the nearest location to work out was the YMCA (which cost 15 dollars per visit!). However, the hotel does have other great options such as the spa, a comedy club, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: margie035
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the heart of downtown Vancouver minutes away from False Creek. That said, I found it to be over-priced. The rooms are comfortable, but outdated. We did manage to get a pretty good deal on our room. I wouldn't stay here for full price. We had a $25 food voucher, which we used for breakfast. Otherwise we left the hotel to eat. We requested a rollaway bed ahead of time, but had to call down to front desk for one when we got to our room. Overall, the service was prompt and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sandy42412
Reviews.Content: The Century -Plaza was in a great location to hop on the Big Bus Hop on Hop off bus that will pick you up right outside the front door and take you to many of the top locations you'll want to see while in Vancouver. It was nice not to have to get the car out of the parking garage and let someone else drive while we caught the site - jumping off whenever we wanted and back on the next bus at our leisure. The hotel was attractive and the view from our room was WOW.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for a central downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chocaholic1001
Reviews.Content: Overall I would recommend the hotel, but I wouldn't set expectations too high. The location is perfect and the staff are all very friendly and helpful. The rooms are large, but they do need to be updated. The beds are comfortable but not luxurious. The kitchenette has basic amenities but is not fully equipped. The water pressure in the shower is phenomenal, but otherwise the bathroom is basic. Overall, it is a good deal, and if price is an issue, I would definitely recommend this as a good choice,

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic City”
Reviews.Author: 2dave
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked in 20.07.2011 for an 10 night stay, we found the staff extremely helpful on all occasions, our suite (1407) was extremely comfortable and the hotel very clean, we didnot make use of the pool or gym as we were too busy looking at all the attractions Vancouver has to offer. As we travelled from the UK our thanks to British Airways for a comfortable flight including connections.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, rooms & value”
Reviews.Author: whalewatchers555
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. I contacted the hotel via email a couple of days earlier with several requests and received a prompt response assuring me that they would do what they could to accommodate these. All requests were met. I found the staff (including maids) to be friendly, smart, polite & happy to assist with any enquiries. Check in & out was speedy. The room was clean & spacey for my family & I. Location was close enough to walk into town, to the beach, the harbour & Stanley park. Vancouver is a beautiful city which I plan to visit again. I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Public Areas, very helpful staff, let down by a very tatty room”
Reviews.Author: TTARRY
Reviews.Content: I was impressed when we walked into the hotel - the lobby is impressive. Staff were always helpful, but especially the doorman(?) who helped with our bags, but more importantly made sure we were OK when one of us fell off a kerb while leaving the hotel one afternoon. The restaurant seemed good, based in the breakfasts we had there. The hotel is close to the centre of downtown - about a 20 minute walk to the Cruise Ship terminal. We had a studio room which was very spacious. It was clean, but very shabby - I wouldn't have wanted to stay there for more than a couple of nights. Since we were there for sightseeing we didn't spend much time in it, but it made for a slightly disappointing end to our holiday

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: R064
Reviews.Content: Our room was large, very clean, comfortable and well appointed. We were on the 24th floor so had great views over Vancouver. The hotel is well situated. The staff were incredibly professional, efficient, courteous and helpful. The only downside is that the food in the Beyond restaurant did not live up to the high standards elsewhere. We would definitely use this hotel if we are lucky enough to visit Vancouver again

Reviews.Title: “Nice big room, great view”
Reviews.Author: SheilasWheels
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Century Plaza and were very impressed by our large room with 2 beds with great views over Vancouver. The room has a microwave and a fridge, coffee maker and kettle (yippee) for my tea! There wasn;t any crockery or cutlery provided which might have been handy (other than mugs), but the restaurant lent us bowls for our morning cereal. There's a table and chairs to eat from. The hotel is handy for shops and restaurants. I used the pool in the basement, but found it a bit creepy - there's no-one else down there and I felt quite ill at ease, but was assured it was covered by CCTV. Just a word of warning about Vancouver, the Chinatown and Gastown areas seem to have a lot of alcoholics and drug adicts which was rather intimidating.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good choice”
Reviews.Author: L&M_from_Oz
Reviews.Content: The Century Plaza Hotel was our choice for 3 nights prior to a Holland America cruise package to Alaska. We had chosen it based on a combination of budget, location and the reviews here on Tripadvisor. Generally, we were happy with the choice. There were plenty of positives for this hotel. Great location, close by to good restaurants in Davie Street and right at the Big Bus hop-on hop-off bus stop #11 in Burrard Street. For your money, you get a big, comfortable apartment with kitchen and full amenities. We had none of the problems with staff that some others on this forum have mentioned. All were courteous, professional and friendly. A couple of negatives, though. Central heating was extremely uncomfortably too hoin our room and could not be adjusted. After complaining at the front desk, the best they could do was to turn it off to our room. That was OK, since the room also had a split system, wall-mounted air conditioner in the lounge room. Also, the bathroom's shower pressure was very ordinary. But, overall the positives out weighed the negatives and we can only recommend the hotel to anyone for either a short term or longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a weekend away”
Reviews.Author: Vowo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is described as a 3.5* suite hotel. The room was nice & a good size, the coffee shop downstairs was good, & it has a good central location, but several things didn't fulfill expectations. The bed was very firm, not uncomfortable, but not exactly luxurious. Several reviews here mention the `full kitchen', but unless a microwave & a sink constitute a full kitchen where you come from then you'll probably be disappointed. The most puzzling thing, however, was that the room didn't have a full ironing board, only one of those mini boards that you have to sit on a table top & on which ironing anything satisfactorily is near to impossible. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone on a business trip. Finally, this hotel still engages in the egregious practice of charging extra for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service and Value for the Dollar!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mica_02_2010
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. I booked it through Hotwire and was able to stay here for 119 per night. I was given a 10 voucher for the hotel restaurant at check in. The service was incredible right from the moment we pulled up. The Consierge and Bag service people were so friendly. The frontdesk staff were incredible. I used the Spa and restaurant during my stay and was thoroughly impressed. This hotel even has a Comedy Club attached to it. I was so highly impressed by what this hotel offers (amenities and freebies) and the incredibly genuine and helpful staff. I will definately stay here again. Such great service and value is rare these days - well done!

Reviews.Title: “Great Expirience & Very clean and modern looking”
Reviews.Author: wrobelchris
Reviews.Content: Definitely recomend this hotel to friends and family. Very modern looking, excellent bed and cleanliness was impressive. We had our anniversary and we really enjoyed the view from 28th floor. Central and easy access to transit and great dining in hotel or around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hanzdatdodishes
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Century Plaza recently on a trip to vancouver and must say I was impressed.Its fair to say the rooms are a little tired in places but the size and fully equipped kitchen more than make up for it.The hotel is also in a great location about 10-15 minute walk to canada Place which is the main port or a 5 minute walk to the heart of the shopping area .I would definitely use this hotel again if visiting Vancouver.There is free wi fi but only in the lobby, there is an in room charge of $10 for 24 hours usage .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mebates00
Reviews.Content: We had 5 nights here. we were upgraded to the 28th floor with a wonderful view of the harbour. Receptions all friendly and helpful as was the porter. The food was great value with the result that we ate breakfast there every morning and had two evening meals as well. free wifi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “"Note to Managment"”
Reviews.Author: ApplButtr
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vancouver many times, and I have stayed at this hotel everytime. Its not brand new like the place across the street,and yes the rooms are dated. But guess what,thats one of the things Ive liked about it,it's always been a taste of old school Vancouver for me.Im easy to please,if its clean I can deal with age. Great location and priced right are a plus for the picky snobs! Being an investor in numerous buisness ventures,I understand a buisness succeed's when it appeal's to the majority of potencial customers. As I have a trip planned to Vancouver in the coming months i like to see what people are saying about the places I plan on visiting while there. In one of your reply's to an unhappy customer is where I found the bad news for me. That being that you are now 100% smoke free. I understand I'm the minority and that you must appeal to the majority to reach your goals. Iv'e been a loyal,satasfied Century Plaza guest/fan for almost 20 years and will continue to refer any non-smoking friends,family,or client's to your establishment. However I cant help but be dissapointed by the fact that now I have to find a new favorite "home" away from home in downtown Vancouver where I can smoke. :~( Best of luck. C.M.M.

Reviews.Title: “Bad rooms pretty lobby.”
Reviews.Author: lou9900
Reviews.Content: do not do it!, spend whatever extra it takes to stay somewhere else. the staff is great, the hotel rooms are vile. i would have left asap but i had an 18 month old with me, it was 11pm and we had been travelling for the whole day, however it was impossible to relax loud and dirty. spend the extra. check out the last persons pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, environmentally friendly, clean and enjoyed the full kitchen.”
Reviews.Author: YellowHoneyBee
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time staying at the Century Plaza. Our room had a full kitchen which was very convenient and the room was spacious. It was always kept clean and I appreciated all the efforts the hotel made to keep it environmentally friendly. From the organic soaps and shampoo to the toilet paper made of recycled paper to having the option of going a day without cleaning, it made our stay that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: TrueCanucks
Reviews.Content: WE spent 4 nights here in early May. Had a large room with a king sized bed, small-ish TV and and dated washroom. It was very comfortable nonetheless and suited our needs to be right downtown Vancouver. The main restaurant has good food but we chose to eat out most of the time due to the limited choices and high prices. The coffee shop in the hotel is also good. WE didn't like the parking: its in a standard parkade behind the building. Anyone from the street could walk in. We didn't think it was safe nor secure. And it cost $17 per night. WE thought perhaps a better guest rate should be offered especially in light of the type of 'service' it really was. I used the spa for a Hawaiin massage. That was FANTASTIC. I called the front desk about getting my hair done and they advised I should just walk in to the salon. I did. I was met with some flippancy and then in a moment or two, told there were no free spots available anymore for the day. The attitude didn't make me want to book for the next day. When we first checked in there were a number of 'irregularities' in the room we were given. Within 5 minutes (honestly, that quickly) a bellman was in our room and had us moved a.s.a.p. to a 'better' room. Interesting. In the new room, we had some troubles with the toilet running. Again, we had but to call and within a few short minutes, a plumber arrived! Excellent service in this regard. We weren't happy that the business center didn't offer free internet service. You have to buy minutes in the coffee shop!

Reviews.Title: “Not plush but excellent location and a great price”
Reviews.Author: KazSeattle
Reviews.Content: Just spent a few days here on a business trip. A recent remodel has left the lobby feeling very upscale and fancy... a pretty big discrepancy when you get to the room floors, which are in a different class than the lobby. Hallways are cramped and a bit claustrophobic. However, for the price, the rooms can't be beat. I was really impressed with how spacious my King bed room was. There was a food area with cooking space, a microwave and refrigerator. The area had a lot of space to spread out and a great view of the city. I got the room for around $115, which is a great value. If you call the hotel directly, it will also beat any rate you get on a travel site. I slept great on the bed, though it was not the best: hard to sit on and not the best quality. The location is spectacular - it's only a few blocks away from everywhere you want to be. Overall, a great budget option in the heart of downtown that is trying hard to improve itself. Worth it, if you're looking to save money.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Tired ...........”
Reviews.Author: JandBNanaimo
Reviews.Content: Took my son and a frried over to Vancouver for the Easter week-end, and decided to stay at the Century Plaza Hotel. The lobby area is very nice, and check-in went smooth. We had booked the "best " room in the hotel to get lots of space, and treat the boys. While the room was clean, it was a little "tired" looking. Older colours, no flat screen TVs, and furniture was okay, nothing special. No closet in the bedroom, and it was quite small with a bed, dresser, and nothing else to make it look appealing. The real problem began when we realized the air conditioner was not working. We had been out and about, and came home in time to go to bed. In the middle of the night we were all cooming, and nobody had a very good sleep. As soon as we got up and ready to go out for the day we stopped in at the Front Desk, and told them we had had a crappy sleep due to temperature and would they please look into it. We went out for the day, arrived back about 3:00 pm and still felt like the room was warm. Called the Front Desk again, and they assured me if I had spoken to someone in the morning it would have been dealt with, but I asked that they check it again, as it didn't seem much better. Myself and the boys went out again and left my husband having a nap. When we arrived back in a few hours and walked inot the room it was like a blanket of warm air hit us. Nobody came while we were gone! I called again, they sent somebody up, and he tried to tell us it was working. We insisted it was not, and we were not going to spend another night in a hot room. At this point they FINALLY moved us to another room. The gentleman who came up was very pleasant, and he helped us relocate, so it was dealt with professionally at that point. The new room was much cooler and we were abel to sleep our second night. All in all, I have stayed in much nicer hotels in Downtown Vacouver - there are oddles to choose from - so would not stay here again. Good basic room, but I prefer something a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: bergy6
