Reviews.Content: This hotel has great value for your money. The location is almost in the center of downtown and within walking distance to most attractions, shopping, lots of good restaurants. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The 1 bedroom suites have a full kitchen with a balcony and even the studios have a small fridge, coffee pot and microwave I find very handy. I have been staying at this hotel for many years and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a view!”
Reviews.Author: eaglemounty
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find, close to public transportation and a pleasant atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: HKTervoert
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at a great location in downtown Vancouver that does not break the bank. The hotel staff are very helpful and courteous and the spa is perfect for a relaxing massage. the rooms are clean and well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, curtious service & a room with a unforgetable view!”
Reviews.Author: JWhiteNL
Reviews.Content: I could not have asked for a better experince. The front desk staff were a breath of fresh air and provided us with detailed information about the city and the services we could have access to during our stay. The entire staff were freindly and worked with smiles on their faces. My room on the 24th floor over looked one of the best views of downtown Vancouver to Stanley Park with a sunset each night that could not be described in words that would do justice to its beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful shelter in a time of need”
Reviews.Author: Rena034
Reviews.Content: I come to St. Paul's Hospital for treatment every three months and Century Plaza feels like my second home. The location is wonderful and with the restaurant and cafe on the premises you can just book in and relax. I look forward to breakfast in Beyond - the beautiful table ware and friendly staff make it such a pleasure to be there.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: P0wens
Reviews.Content: Hotel well placed close to all shops including grocery shop! Room spacious and very well equipped, spotlessly clean. The staff really made this hotel special- i was a solo traveller new to everything- the assistance was knowledgeable, thorough and accurate- i had to travel to Vancouver Island early in the morning utilising public transport- amazing directions- did it easily. Felt welcoming and friendly. Firw alarm one evening was well run and calmly managed, cant rate this place high enough- they made what could have been a stressful time into one that i was actually quite sad to leave. Thank you one and all

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Truckie79
Reviews.Content: My family traveled up from Washington State for the Cheer Competition at the Convention Center. We received a block rate from the hotel from April 1st- 3rd. t $109 we thought we were getting a great rate, but after checking in (and many families only found out upon checking out) this did not include the $17 a day parking OR the tax on either of these items. What I thought was going to be a $250 bill for the room in fact cost almost $300. Other people who called ahead of time to be sure they had enough money for everything were never informed of the need for paying for parking or how much the tax is and quite a few were scraping by at the end of the trip. Keep in mind this is a group of at least 40-50 families that are booked here. I also requested a room next to a friend, she did the same, we were put a floor above her. After talking to other people we found out that they "lost" all the requests made reservations were made monthes ago, and I had been told it was still in there Tuesday when I called to confirm my reservation. The elevators were extremely slow. There was a 30 minute wait at times for the 4 elevators, and only 2 seemed to be running at any time. The gentleman at the door was nice enough to open the smallest last one when lines got too long but it was never working long and there was constantly a line in the lobby. No free internet in your rooms, that was a $9 surcharge (as well as a .65 charge for any local call? local calls are charged?). I finally was told by someone else that you could get free wifi if you were in the lobby, and that was after asking why so many people were down there with laptops taking ALL the seats available down there. The pool is on the lower level (LL) there is a way there from the stairs but more people seemed to use the elevators making the wait even longer. Once it picked up people from the pool, it would often open on the lobby and be too packed for anyone to get on. Not that you would want to be crammed into an elevator with wet kids and adults anyway. The rooms are big, I had double beds and a full kitchenette. Everything is outdated however. The room was sweltering when we arrived, and we had to turn on the air conditioning. You could not set it belove 20C (70F) or it would freeze. When I opened the filter on top of the unit it was clogged with dust! There is no fitted sheet on the beds, just a regular one tucked in, and they have tears in them. The carpets look dirty but not sure if its the color or what. The shower BLASTS you and is set way too high, you cant make it lower. I am 5'4" and it hurt me, my 4 year old was disappointed she could not take a shower, it pushed her down. The shower curtain does nothing to contain the torrent of water either, the floor gets wet no matter what you try. My real only positive experience was the ONE greeter(?) when you came in the hotel. I saw him a few times through my stay and he was always polite and tried to help me out with anything I asked. There was another I saw constantly around but he seemed to be playing on his cell phone most of the time. The only maps to be found in the hotel to where anything is, is on every floor there is a fire escape route. Overall, I would never stay here again. I did not try out the spa (I did not like that the one time I saw someone in there you can see them walking around in the bathrobe and slippers from outside the hotel) or did I venture to the steam room (I never found it). With our Cheer Team travelling much of the season, we have stayed in a few hotels and this being the first one out of the country for me, I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Some what disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: KimH67
Reviews.Content: I suppose with the title of my review, you would guess it to be completely negative. While that is not the case, I will say, over all, my experience here was slightly disappointing. I will, however,start with the positives. 1) The Hotel is close to down town, and so location is fabulous. 2) There was parking, and internet. 3) Staff was friendly. 4) We were able to check in early, having arrived an hour and a half before the normal check-in time of 3pm. That was wonderful! 5) The room was clean, and large and the beds were comfortable. 6) For the four of us, booking through Tavelocity.com, got the room for a failrly decent price. On to the more negative side. 1) Getting from the parking to the actual lobby was confusing and difficult with all our luggage. Either up (or down, I am not sure, as I said, getting around in there was very confusing) the stairs, or out side (walking down the three levels), along the side walk, and into the Hotel through a side door, or further around to the front entrance. 2) The elevators. Slow, small...and slow, slow, slow. I mean 20 minutes wait at times. I almost wanted to attempt climbing the 11 floors of stairs on a number of occasions. When an elevator DID arrive, it was often over crowded, and not able to hold myself and three kids. 3) Hot water. The morning check out of 11 seemed early, and because of this, we didn't all have time to shower. Even attempting to wash my face, I had no hot water in the sink, even though I turned on no cold water. That being said, my son and his friend were both able to shower around that same time, but I was not able to get any in the bathroom sink at ALL. 4) Though we were able to GET internet in our room, I was disappointed to find a charge for it. I have stayed at many hotels, of higher and lower quality than this one, and have never had to pay for internet before if it was available, in-room. If this is normal procedure, I am not aware of it. 5) We were quite excited to find a pool and sauna were at the Hotel, but it was in the basement,with the elevators not working properly, this was inconvenient, and the sauna had a horrible horrible smell that only increased as it got hotter. Very unpleasant. Also, seeing a room key is needed for access to the pool, I was disappointed to find the pool closed after 10pm. I would have enjoyed swimming after coming back in, but not being so limited on time. 6) We were booked as one adult with three kids. (under 18) It was myself and three boys 17,16, and 16. We had two twin beds and one pull out couch. There was no extra bedding provided for our "third" child, and when I called housekeeping, to ask for an extra blanket, the one we were given was an old, scratchy blanket. I was pleased we were able to get one, in a timely manner, at that late hour (we had just gotten back to our room after a concert, and it was approx. 10:30 pm), but I was disappointed in its' quality. 7) Though the room rate was quite reasonable, I might consider paying a bit more for better quality or ammenities next time. Over all, though slightly disappointed, I would consider staying there again, mostly due to location and cost. If I was able to shop around on price, I would do so before my next stay. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “So many other fabulouse accommodation choices, why bother with this one?!”
Reviews.Author: KVeracious
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Expedia for a decent rate and it was also recommended by a friend. It was a stop over stay before we headed off to Ucluelet & Tofino. The fact that we did not pay full price and that we were just beginning a much needed vacation, are the only reasons we were ultimately not as upset as we could have been. Here are the reasons we will never recommend this hotel to our family and friends. Not even our acquintances, actually. 1. Poor initial first impression/Lack of welcome: Since we were planning on a week long vacation in a condo, we had more than the usual amount of baggage for a one night stay. While my friend and I organized our belongings (she was smart and made reservations at the Delta Suites!), my husband went inside to find a bellman to assist us. I was surprised that he came back with just a bell cart as there were clearly two bellman leaning on the pillars in the lobby, watching us unload our items. Both my husband and I have spent over 15 years in the hospitality industry (particularly working for 4 - 5 star hotels/resorts companies), so we can be quite comfortable and self-sufficient in a hotel setting that it wouldn't be odd for us to offer the staff assistance with our luggage. No matter where we've stayed, the bellman have never let us take a bellcart when they were standing idle. It felt odd to be pushing our own bellcart and only because the 2 bellman kept looking over and smiling. Perhaps their hourly wage is high enough that tips/grats are no longer a motivation?!! Even the Front Desk staff didn't offer us any assistance with the cart although it was obviously ours as there were no other check ins while we were checking in. The woman who checked us in simply went through the motions, like she was reading off of a script. I have done her job before and it is not hard at all to have a warm, welcoming conversation while ensuring that all check in procedures are completed properly. 2. Extremely slow elevators: Without exaggeration, we spent 20 minutes waiting for an elevator. We had to let 1 go by because it was already too full to allow a bell cart to fit. Of the 3 elevators, only 1 seemed to be stopping on the Lobby level. After a long drive from the Okanagan to the city (heavy snow, then heavy rain), we were short on patience. Not once did a staff member come by to apologize or explain why only 1 elevator seemed to be working. Perhaps the elevators double as service/staff elevators?! That would explain why the other two were locked on certain floors. 4. Mediocre guest rooms: Although our room was spacious and the full size fridge came in handy, you could hear what the neighbours were up to and in our case, it was a post-clubbing party. It's a good thing we were so exhausted that when we eventually did fall asleep, we stayed asleep! The TV was situated at an odd angle and we think this is to accommodate viewing from both the bed and the couch across from it. Either way, it didn't work well for viewing. The bed sheets were scratchy and the blankets were quite thin. I kept my shoes on while awake as the carpet was quite dingy. 5. Dismal Last impression: At least the woman checking us out was smiling although, although there was no inquiry about how our stay was. Now I'm not sure if the cafe adjacent to the lobby, by the main entrance is run by the hotel, but service was again, poor if non existent. There were no other customers in the cafe. At first I didn't see the beverage menu as it is on a LCD screen that changes every few minutes so of course I asked. The woman behind the counter could barely force a smile to her face no matter that I was trying to be gracious and friendly. It truly felt like I was intruding on her day. Overall, a disappointing experience no matter how you spin it. Not sure why the quality of service was so poor. Having been in the staff's shoes and having managed staff in their positions, it is abundantly clear when a staff does not care versus a staff who is overwhelmed and therefore cannot meet expectations. As I mentioned earlier, we were often the only guests requiring assistance and they just stood around. Do yourself a favour and pay a wee bit more and stay at one of the other great hotels Downtown Vancouver has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: KJBCHB
Reviews.Content: I am not sure where to begin...I will start by saying that my husband and I travel quite a bit and stay in many types of accomodations....From budget to luxury. We are not high maintenance people. We can accept minor flaws and misunderstandings with kindness and grace. I have worked in many aspects of the customer service industry so I can understand when things just don't go right. I will leave honest and detailed reviews without trying to sound like a snooty hoity-toity. We have stayed in Vancouver many times but this was our first with Century Plaza. I was hoping for a bit more luxury on this stay but certainly did NOT get it. Maybe my mistake was that I booked a studio suite for three nights through Booking.com. They offered the best price ($83 CAD) compared to other travel sites($120-$160 CAD). I requested a king size bed instead of two doubles since my husband is over 6'2" and a bed hog. When we entered our room it had two doubles. I called the front desk to see if we could change rooms. I was told that since we booked through Booking.com that any request I made would not be honoured. Had I booked "exclusively through the hotel they would be happy to change our room." I asked the front desk clerk if that meant I was a second class guest and they replied with "pretty much". Ok. Whatever. But the story does not end here...The room was incredibly hot and a window had been previously opened by housekeeping (I assume) but it still was sweltering. The thermostat to the ancient baseboard heater was off and we couldn't find any switches on the unit itself but did notice a bunch of bare and exposed wires peaking out from the baseboard that the unit was falling off the wall. That certainly would not be acceptable in most places. I called once again to the front desk and asked how to turn off the heat completely. They sent up a houseman with a pair of pliers or a wrench and he tweaked something on the baseboard and it was finally off. I also find fault with the fact that the bed and curtains and TV cords were all resting on or very, very near the baseboard. Fire hazzard? The AC had a years worth of dust on and in it. As we were trying to settle in I opened both very old windows ( no balcony in this particular room) and noticed that one window had a lock so you can only open it about a foot wide. The other window lock was broken and it opened all the way. There are no screens on these windows and are rather close to the room floor so anyone could easily fall out and from the 22nd floor that would not be a good landing. The noise of sirens ( over two dozen times), traffic and people from down below are well heard from even this high up. The room itself was falling apart and the kitchen wasn't the cleanest. We can accept old age and a little wear and tear but this was ridiculous. The outside of the toilet bowl had black stains all the way to the floor. The shower had plenty of water pressure but the shower head was set so high and couldn't point it downward that the explosion of water almost pushed me through the wall behind me! I am 5'6" and the water flow pelted me right in the face. Very uncomfortable and it sure did a number on my delicate facial skin. Anything brass was now well rusted. Food garbage in the drawer under the stove/oven. The refigerator/freezer doors opened away from the tiny kitchen so that made it annoying and difficult to access anything inside while trying to cook at the stove. The corners of kitchen floor still had leftovers of many guests past. Pieces of wall were missing and metal was exposed at wall corners. I get that folks crash their luggage into these but come on, for the price of the room it should be much better cared for. The doors to the room are paper thin. While walking through the halls you can hear various guests using the bathroom and every word of their conversations. A fact that sucked at 3am every night when the partiers return to their rooms screaming and bouncing around. I did not sleep much the entire stay due to this fact. One afternoon they had problems with their fire alarm and it kept ringing. Twice we were on alert as to what to do. Thankfully they were false alarms but due to electrical issues. Which didn't make me feel much better. Electrical issues can start fires..(thinking of our baseboard heater). In order to get ice for your room the guest services book suggests you call for room service or go all the way to the lobby floor with your bucket and retrieve ice from the restaurant. When I called room service she told me I had to go down and get it myself. Just what I want to do while on vacation. We had one itty-bitty ice tray in our freezer that might supply ice for two small glasses which was empty upon arrival. Now on to the parking. You can park your vehicle in their garage for $17 CAD a night PLUS tax! That comes out to $22.61 CAD PER night. A bit much considering you have to park on level 3 or higher and the creepy and steep staircase to get to any elevator was less than safe feeling. It appeared that it was public parking for anyone and the doors to get into the hotel are not locked. Anyone might be lurking in the stairwell. If there was another way to access the parking & our vehicle we were not told of it. The staff was nice enough. All in all it wasn't a horrible stay but definately VERY dissapointing. I am very glad I did not pay the normal higher price for this room. I wonder though if we got an inferior room because of reserving through Booking.com. Had we booked "exclusively" through the hotel would it have been any better?

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglandFrequentflyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights here from Sunday 13 March 2011 - room was huge, with good seating area, dining table, kitchen area and massive bed!! We were on 20th floor - lifts a bit slow, but not too bad. Went swimming in pool a lot - yes, this is in the basement and it's a bit gloomy, but I had whole thing to myself most of the time, so am not complaining! Our room overlooked the hospital, but I only heard sirens a couple of times, it certainly didn't disturb me - the only disturbance came in the form of some jock-type hockey players bellowing outside our room one night, but it was only one night and they shut up when I opened the door and bellowed back! Didn't eat in the restaurant as there were so many good places to eat near here, but I did have room service a couple of nights and the food was great! The location is brilliant, so near all the shops and the train station, and there was always a cab outside if you wanted to go further afield. Vancouver is a truly beautiful city, and is best explored on foot anyway. My only complaint was having to pay $5.60 to use the internet in the coffee shop - was a rip off, when most other hotels nowadays have free access - my advice is, go to Vancouver public library, where access is free - only discovered this the day before we left! Overall, very enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel if your suffer from asthma , mcs or like clean air”
Reviews.Author: oberon099
Reviews.Content: I became very sick in this hotel and noticed a very strong air chemical perfumey scent that permeated the entire building-not only in my room but in the corridors, elevator lobby etc. Nothing was confirmed when I complained about the smell but I suspect that they are using a chemical air scent product that they are dispersing throughout the hotel via their hvac system and/or spray rooms and furniture down with chemical air scent product. They are probably doing this to cover the smell of tobacco and mildew. I do not recommend this hotel if you have asthma or multiple chemical sensitivities or enjoy breathing clean air.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service, pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: tdktraveler
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel while in town for a seminar held just down the street. Hotel staff is always friendly, helpful and professional. This time I booked my studio room during an internet sale and while their rates are normally quite reasonable, it was even lower. Then upon check in, I was upgraded to a one bedroom suite (even without requesting it!). I love having the kitchenette or small kitchen in the room, and with a market just down the block, I can grab breakfast in my room without hassle. Room was clean and updated - they are not luxury, but an older hotel with nice, clean updated rooms. When I inquired about the heat in the bedroom being too high despite turning off the thermostat, they promptly sent someone to the room to adjust it. When I needed clean towels they were at my door within minutes. I ordered room service on my previous visit, which was fast and good. Having a coffee shop in the lobby is a nice plus. Overall a nice experience. I do wish in-room internet wasn't a daily charge, but that seems to be the norm in that part of town unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and HUGE room!”
Reviews.Author: soundofmusicfan
Reviews.Content: What a find in central Vancouver! It was perfectly located for our stay in Vancouver - we were able to walk to Granville Island and Robson Street as well as Gastown. The room was huge with a great kitchen area complete with oven and microwave. The "spa" was slightly disappointing - nice pool but needs a bit of an overhaul and we couldnt get the hang of the steam room.

Reviews.Title: “a deal downtown...”
Reviews.Author: NG_Travel
Reviews.Content: My first impression we came came to the desk: arrogant and cold staff...Fortunately they were not at all like the "lady" we had when we checked in... The room was big and fully furnished, it was a real deal...We paid 78$/per night...No fitting room, but a pool and a steam room...No internet in the room, but you can get it in the lobby...

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: ThaCet
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in the heart of Downtown, close to Skytrain and buses. Really good deal with a great staff helping. You should ask to be up in the hotel, the view is just amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartment style hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldaviator
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroom suite, and we were glad to have done this. The layout of our room felt like an apartment, and I love how there are separate areas for the living room, kitchen and bedroom. Our view from the 9th floor was facing North, and we could see the infamous green roof of the Fairmont. The shower pressure in our bathroom was fantastic. Never had I stayed in a room where the water was nice and hot and the pressure was just simply outstanding. The heat and and the modern a/c unit worked well. It was so hot in our room that we had to turn on the a/c just to keep the room comfortable. It was nice to have a microwave and refrigerator for those late night snacks. There was even a stove to do some cooking if you so desired. Now the only areas for improvement in our opinion are the beds, which were not comfortable to sleep on. I would recommend bringing a mattress topper if you could. The furnishings are a bit dated, though. The parking garage could really use some help as water puddles formed in certain parts of the garage. Wi-fi connection was strong in our room but we did not purchase a day pass, for 9 CAD. The lobby and restaurant were beautiful. Although we had a $10 voucher for use for dining, we didn't have a chance to try their dining options. All in all, we would definitely stay at this hotel. The location to Davie Street , Robson Street and being right on Burrard across the street from the Sheraton make this a centrally nice place to stay in Downtown Vancouver.,

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but too many buts...”
Reviews.Author: raingirl4
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and bright but we didn't have any heat in our room. when we called the front desk to complain as we were freezing we were informed that the boiler was broken. We were cold all night long but we did get extra blankets! We had a $10.00 coupon for the restaurant " beyond" but our breakfast was cold. Asked for a new waffle , but the waiter was really uncaring. Mentioned the problems to the front desk at check-out but no compensation was offered but they did apologize...again. Would not recommend this hotel to my friends or family. Oh, there was parking but it was very expensive considering there wasn't anywhere else that you could park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: cityygirl_
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Century Plaza hotel as it was a friends birthday and we wanted a weekend getaway. The service was great as the staff were so kind and helpful with what we were looking for and more! The rooms itself are what you pay for so don't expect too much or too little, I would however suggest to the building to have more lights as it was quite dark! But nonetheless it was a great place and great location to everything!

Reviews.Title: “be careful of bate and switch”
Reviews.Author: sabellows2002
Reviews.Content: I made reservations to stay at the Century Plaza with my adult children. When I plugged in the amount for the number of people, I entered four adults. I got a very decent rate through Hotels.com. When I made the reservation, I asked if there would be any extra person charges, because of the fine print that said the hotel may or may not charge for extra persons. I didn't want any surprises when I checked out. The person making the reservations contacted the front desk and was told that there wouldn't be any extra charges. After paying for the room, a confirmation was sent to me and in there it stated that there wouldn't be any extra person charges. The next day I got a call directly from the hotel. They said there would be a $30 extra person charge. I called the hotel directly to speak with them and asked them to please honor the orginal contract.They would not do so. They tried to pass the blame onto Hotel.com, and even tried to somehow make it my fault. I was totally transparent on my end, putting in that there would be four people, and I just wanted to know beforehand of any extra charges. I feel that the Century Plaza staff did not handle this in a professional way. They should have apologized to me and honored the original contract. I noticed that the next day the rates went up. I feel that they try to get people in with the good rates (bate) and then tell them later the rate will be higher (switch). I now have to wait a week to get the charges reversed on my credit card. Yes, I did cancel my reservation. It isn't so much about the extra $30, but more about the unprofessional and unethical manner in which this transaction was handled. Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: KayL49
Reviews.Content: Good quality hotel, very roomy, kitchenette - booked on hotwire.com for reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect suite/apartment”
Reviews.Author: GaiaGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Though we stayed earlier at this hotel , I found it sufficiently good enough not to be forgotten on any future trips to Vancouver . The suite was fine , with a good bedroom , livingroom with kitchnette , and a good bathroom , plus a varanda/balcony . As usual in most hotels , the restaurant does no honours to the quality of the hotel : Variety of meals to decide is rather small , and though the service is courteous/friendly , the quality of the dinner served to us (myself & Isabel) remains a 3 star category (nothing special ...) J. Lucena Gaia

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...If you can get a deal”
Reviews.Author: 2tall4red
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for 3 nights while in town for a convention. I booked the room based on a special I came across on Travelzoo ($149/night including parking, internet). I would agree with many of the comments previously stated on this property but will add a few things. Overall the hotel is a good find for Vancouver. It is an older property that has been renovated more recently and I think is still in partial of stages of renovations. The lobby is very modern and nice but that somewhat stops at the elevator. Those were small and not as speedy as would be liked for a 30 story hotel. I was on the 29th floor and it took sometime to get a ride especially during peak times. That said, my room was excellent. I reserved a King Executive suite, which are limited to the upper floors (24-30 I think) and what a room it was. It had a full kitchen, marble bath with whirlpool tub, large living room with a 50" TV, smaller separate bedroom and a nice balcony overlooking the city, mountains and ocean. The room was updated with newer furnishings and fit the style of the lobby. This tells me they are slowly updating the rooms as some reviews say the rooms are not updated, but mine certainly was. The views were priceless and made you want to stay in the room and watch the sunset. A couple of things that were not great was the AC is small for the large room and the bedroom was a bit hot. Also, the interent did not work. I could not connect and finally gave up. And the noise from the streets below is evident and the windows are not sound proof. I could hear loud conversations 29 floors up. Did seem to quiet down at night so sleeping was ok. Otherwise, great room. I ate in the restaurant and it was excellent. Also they have a nice coffee shop attached which provides fairly priced drinks, pasteries and gelato(good evening snack). In the end the hotel is worth the price I paid and I was very happy I choose this place. The location is excellent and within walking distance to just about anything. Vancouver is a nice city to walk if the weather is nice. Get out and enjoy it if you can. Stanley Park is beautiful and affords views of the city you cannot miss.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Views! Sleepless nights!”
Reviews.Author: mdbigred
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked thru Expedia, and was told we would have an Executive Suite. We ended up in a Studio "suite" which was only a suite by definition because it had a couch (not a pull-out) and a fridge. I was visiting from Seattle, with my parents from the Midwest. I'd been to Vancouver - they had not. I'll echo others here - the location makes this hotel well worth it. Granville and Robson Streets within a few blocks walk.The lobby is nice and modern, rooms are ok at best. We didn't end up spending much time in the room, however. Had breakfast in the hotel restaurant (with a $10 voucher). My eggs benedict was very nice. The hop on/hop off "Big Bus" tour stopped right outside so we utilized that for a day. I gave it 3 due to the rooms needing updating, and us not getting what we reserved (and their inability to accomodate). Great view of Burrard Street and the northern part of the city though. If you keep your expectations modest, you'll be happy. If you want lavish interiors - head to the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lobby is beautiful however rooms less spectacular”
Reviews.Author: cashmom
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel. The lobby has been beautifully updated however my room and the cleanliness did not match the first impression. The grout in the tiling of floors really needs cleaning, also I dropped an earring on floor in bathroom and when I bent down to pick it up noticed the brown yucky stuff under rim on tub.After maid service the same pieces of paper on carpet and dirt were still there. The kitchen sink ( no matter how long the tap was run ) did not have hot water therefore I was carrying water in ice bucket from bathroom to kitchen to wash dishes....finally gave up ! On my first night I was awoken at 7:00 a.m. by construction noise. When i queried this at the front desk the girl was very abrupt and made some comment about city regulations. At this point Matt stepped in and cheerfully changed my room. Thanks Matt !

Reviews.Title: “SPECTACULAR, GREAT, WOULD LIVE THERE IF I COULD”
Reviews.Author: goodfood-goodfun
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 24th floor (maybe the 25th). Had an end suite with a full kitchen and balcony. What a wonderful room. The french doors that open to the bedroom are lovely. The bathroom is large and has plenty of counter space. The full kitchen is just that, a full kitchen and fully equiped. The staff is very accomodating. And the view of the city from the room - breathtaking. I would live in this hotel if I could. The room we had included a breakfast for two in the restaurant each day; the selection for breakfast items is limited to one of three choices. All three choices are very, very good and made the stay even more pleasureable. The location is great for walking to gas town, China town and the conference centre. And if you want to workout at the gym at the Y, it is just across the street. The room, the location, the breakfast makes this hotel a real deal and great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Hope You Don't Want Hot Water”
Reviews.Author: MiamiTravelers_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel while in Vancouver for three days. Rooms very spacious with a balcony but very drab and very plain. First morning while taking a shower there was no hot water. Reported to front desk and said they would take care of. Our friends in the next room also did not have hot water they too reported to front desk. The water pipes rattle and vibrate so hard from the room next door that it vibrated the wall behind the bed. Our friends did NOT have any hot water for 3 days. We finally told them to take a shower in our room so they could at least have a warm shower. The location is great very central to sight seeing Vancouver easy walking distance to some areas. While staff was very friendly and accomodating the hot water situation was never taken care of for our friends in room next door. Only credit given to them was no charge for a bottle of water! Very disappointed in this hotel after reading recommendations from other TripAdvisor travelers but we did not have a good experience there.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cindy_Matteo
Reviews.Content: the hotel is nice, centrally located. Clean. Room was very spacious and had a small kitchen with fridge and microwave. Breakfast was included in the rate but it was nothing to write home about you have a choice of three between pancakes, waffle and bacon and eggs... none of them are very good. The waitress was very sweet and understanding and managed to give us something else 2 days out of three (although we know for a fact that changes were not allowed). Sky train is 4/5 blocks away. Lots of good reastuarants in the area - we ate at the keg and it was very good, then ate at cactus... good as well. Shopping on robson road is just minutes away. The only this is that the room - which had views on Burrard street was a little noisy- hospital is next door so ambulances come and go!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, good location!”
Reviews.Author: danb26
Reviews.Content: Our suite was much nicer than expected, two double beds, kitchenette and a beautiful view over Vancouver, food was okay and over-priced (as all hotels in fairness) but generally, a very positive experience. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: liketotravel59102
Reviews.Content: The worst! The cleaning lady was in our room at 9 a. m. when we returned from breakfast. Asked her to leave, she came back in 2 more times, and then I had to tell her to leave until we checked out. The staff told us to leave our bags and all the purchases we had bought, in the car in a specific parking spot, a "secured parking garage" for hotel guests and Spa guests. We had a horrible experience in the Spa for one hour, and upon returning to our locked car and trunk, found it broken into with EVERYTHING WE HAD GONE! Staff said it happens all the time. It really wasn't a secured parking area, it was a public lot. Said they were sorry, but nothing they could do. They didn't even refund our money that we paid for the SECURED PARKING!!! What a scam. Very disappointed, and the idea that they know it happens all the time is unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous View from the 27th floor”
Reviews.Author: Islanddaze
Reviews.Content: We are staying in room 2709 at the Century Plaza now (August 15-22) and are having a wonderful time. We are in an Executive King Room, which i think is the highest grade room. The room is a corner room with views of the Mountains, Pacific, and the city. We enjoy watching the Sea Planes come in from the comfort of our sofa, and the seagulls pass by the 27th floor while crossing from English Bay over to the Sound. So the viewing from the apartment is great. Room are comfortable, and staff has been friendly and helpful. There is a complimentary steam room for all guests, definetly enjoy a 1/2 hour steam after a long day of walking. Great hotel, I would recommend to my family.

Reviews.Title: “best trip of life”
Reviews.Author: rdssk8erx2
Reviews.Content: aside from the fact that i won 2 sets of Canucks game tickets that year, the hotel was awesome, beside the fact that my dad had to pay a little more money on the hotel cost cause of things i was doing in the room, like PPV movies and video games, it was a good dwelling, but i didn't really do much else in the hotel cause we were around downtown and what not, but i would for sure go back there again, its about a 2 block or so walk from BC place and GM place, so you don't really have to cab anywhere. and that was nice

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TSO
Reviews.Content: Booked thro Expedia Room was on 16th floor with great views No complaints Cooking facilities an asset as Vancouver is not a cheap destination

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the money”
Reviews.Author: Advisor21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights at the Century Plaza. It was a decent place to stay for the price, which we found a great deal on Hotels.ca that the hotel beat by an additional 5%. The room wasn't as modern as the lobby looked, but was large and clean. We were there over the long weekend and it wasn't noisy other than the sirens at the hospital. Nice hotel for the price. Parking was additional $17 per day to park in the hotel parking area, which actually isn't bad for downtown Vancouver. Dislikes: - right near St. Paul's Hospital so you hear sirens at all hours of the night - no a/c in the bedroom only in the living room area - tiny bathroom (have to pretty much climb over the toilet to get to the tub when the door is open) Likes: - our room was a large corner room with lots of windows - kitchenette suite (fridge, stove, microwave, toaster) - great location other than the hospital next door - great staff service

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Resonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: DeepakKhemani
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver for a Convention in the second week of June for 6 days and the Century Plaza Hotel and Spa couldn't have been a better choice. Right in the heart of Downtown,reasonable room rates, I was in a Suite on the 21st Floor great view, very spacious, neat and clean rooms, big double beds along with a sofa, a kitchenette, a coffee table and a large LCD TV. The only downside is that this hotel is right next to a hospital and you will definitely be woken up in the middle of the night, every night at least once by an ambulance siren. Also this hotel offers free wi-fi internet only in the lobby. Otherwise there is a charge of 9$ for 24 hours. I checked with all other hotels in the area and almost every hotel has free internet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: jaa12
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I planned a very last minute trip to Vancouver for his 25th birthday. We are young and budget conscious, but I am definitely kind of a princess when it comes to lodgings and I don't like swapping comfort for savings. We found a really good deal on rooms at this hotel (considering how late we started looking) and after reading a few unfavorable reviews online, I was a little skeptical whether we made the right choice when booking with them. I couldn't have been more wrong! The minute we pulled up and walked inside I was relieved and excited about our choice. We arrived at almost midnight after traveling all day, and the staff was so refreshingly friendly and helpful when checking us in (I later learned that this is quite the Canadian way!) The gentleman at the front desk was so kind as to direct us to a few places to get some cheap late night eats, even though the hotel has its own restaurant and room service options. It was when we walked outside to find a slice of pizza that I began to appreciate what a great location the hotel is in. Bordered by the colorful west end and some of the most upscale shopping areas of Vancouver, the city streets were definitely alive but as we walked around our first night and I never felt unsafe or threatened. Vancouver has a somewhat aggressive homeless population, but we were never bothered when we were spending any time near the hotel. Vancouver is a very walkable city, and from our hotel we could walk to see all of the city's greatest sights: Stanley Park, Granville Island, Yaletown. There was also a large selection of restaurants and shopping just within a few blocks so we never had to walk far if we didn't want to! I would definitely recommend this as a great place to stay for those who have never been to Vancouver before and aren't sure what to expect. Definitely a safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great facilities”
Reviews.Author: Catzmagic
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. We booked a studio suite because it was the lowest priced room available, and we got a lot of room for our money! The staff were really helpful - thanks to the bell captain's advice (I think that's what they called him - the guy on the information desk!) we were able to complete our onward journey without the expense of getting a taxi to the ferry port or the hassle of lugging bags all over the place. We also ate in the restaurant where the food was good but the service average (we saw two waiting staff and one was significantly better than the other).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Octo-Mom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Century Plaza last week, I had a wonderful stay. The rooms were clean and done up nicely and felt very comfortable, the service was wonderful and the area was also brilliant. I would strongly reccomend this hotel to anyone staying in Vancouver. I had no problems with the staff and they were always ready to help with any requests I had. I also had a very ice view from my room so if you do stay at this hotel, request a room on a higher floor. The only problem I had was that the beds were just a little to hard. As for the other review here stating that Vancouver is dangerous, they must have gone out in night in areas (Gastown/Chinatown) that are known to be dangerous. Vancouver has consistantly been ranked as one of the most liveable citys in the world and for a city of it's size the crime is very low; lived in Vancouver for a few years and can honestly say I feel safe walking downtown at night as long as you use common sense.

Reviews.Title: “Right in heart of downtown.. but watch out.. Vancouver is dangerous”
Reviews.Author: sapbloke
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on Rockies Tour. Thsi hotel is in the heart of Downtown Vancouver. Tower block type. We were on 10th floor with great views. Room: Massive - totally massive. 2 double beds, settee, kitchenette, coffee table. Cant fault if .. was a great room. Beds a bit used but hey.. tis expected. Food: No point in getting breakfast here as its in the middle of downtown so your surrounded by coffee shops etc. We had agoodbye meal with others on our tour - nouveau type.. looked good, tasted good, but not a lot of it. A bit pricy too. Location: right in the heart of downtown vancouver. Vancouver .. very dangerous. Avoid Gastown / Chinatown. Gangs of druggies, down n outs , beggars... and i mean 100's of them down alleys in bins etc. Will never go back there. others in our party also ran into trouble too in those areas. Beware of going toward s the south end of Burrand street and going left roudn the block .. sex shops and strip joints. Stay on the tours and in groups. Ive been in London, Berlin, Paris, Oslo - this is the most dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: TravelinTRav
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Century Plaza for a long weekend. The hotel was a great price and terrific location. The hotel staff was accommodating from the beginning, switching us from a room with two double beds to a nicer room with a king bed at no extra cost. We were able to walk everywhere from the terrific location including Stanley Park and the great restaurants on Robson and Davie streets. Clean, quiet room at a good price in a great city!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Lightmeup
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks in Canada, firstly staying at the Pacific Palisades in Downtown Vancouver for a few days unfortunately this was converted to affordable apartments at the end of April we then went to the Yukon for a week before seeing out the last few days in the Century Plaza. I do not know whether it was because of the exemplary service from the previous two hotels but this felt a bit of a let down to a great holiday. The staff on arrival weren't over friendly, it took the receptionist about a minute to acknowledge our presence and say he wouldn't be a minute, we then got to our room which overlooked the hospital opposite yet there was no blinds on the windows to stop people looking in, simple things like light bulbs not working in the bathroom didn't add to the charm. The location was good, the brilliant thing about downtown Vancouver being you can walk from one end to the other in around half an hour. We did not use the hotel facilities, preferring to eat out and general explore the city for those last few days. If you are looking for nightlife and access to the shopping on Robson street this is a good location but you might look with envy at the hotel across the road- it was a Sheraton or Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “A whole lot of paint doesn't cover the dirt”
Reviews.Author: speksy
Reviews.Content: The Century Hotel (lets leave out the spa for now) is a really well advertised trick. Though it is sufficient for a short stay and looks good in pictures, it might as well be a Best Western (did it use to be a Best Western?). The lobby will trick you into thinking you are in a boutique hotel but once you get to your room it is a different story. The rooms are greasy and the carpet is mossy. The beds seem just a little dirty (I'm sure, like once reviewer said, that bed bugs must be plentiful). The word "Spa" is tacked on loosely at the end. Go across the street to the Sheraton Wall Center spa if you want to relax. But if you're on a budget the Century Hotel will come up in your search as a top pick. Just expect a Best Western, not a Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value-Ask for Abdul”
Reviews.Author: Clear4Takeoff99
Reviews.Content: My wife booked the room for $95/night. Her meeting was across the street at a hotel that was $185/night. I thought the Century was a bargain. The rooms were very nice and comfortabe. I think the real key to enjoying the hotel is the Concierge, Abdul. He steered us to several spots for lunch, etc that made our trip more enjoyable. One dinner place to try is Stephos (sp?) a Greek restaurant on Davie St. Davie Street is a little avante garde or maybe hip but don't miss checking it out. There was a line of about 20 people out the door waiting to get in and in my book that means a great place to eat. It was! I asked a lady in line why there were so many people lined up and she said, "great food and it is cheap." She was right. It was very reasonable and excellent. It is sort of a family run type of place and not fancy but it has great food. I tried the Mousaka and it was fabulous! Another must visit place is Artegiano's Cafe. This place has the best coffee drinks I have ever had, bar none! I won't go into great detail here but you simply have to try this place if you like coffee. As my wife said, "I don't really like coffee and I thought it was great!" Both places are a short walk from the Century. Say hi to Abdul and enjoy your stay at the Century!

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: lovemass
Reviews.Content: The 'Century Plaza' in downtown Vancouver has seen better days, although located in a most central location, within walk distance to the town center and the more 'cool' areas, over all i can say that it is not in a good shape, and don't let the nice renovated and modern lobby trick you, the rooms are in desperate need of massive renovation, and carpet / furniture change, all are old well used and beyond cleaning. All rooms are extra big and include a nice kitchen space, and a clean bath, but all the rest can make the stay unpleasant, it is clear the the rooms has been in use for years. On top of that, you are asked to pay for internet use in your room, a basic service that usually is giving for free, for guests, a fact that forces you to go downstairs to the lobby and use the public access. On the other hand the service personal are all extremely nice, helpful, and patient, whether it's the lady who cleans the rooms, the receptionists or the concierge, all are excellent, but they can not compensate for the management who seem to try and save by maintaining, "vintage" rooms. Of course we didn't spend too much time in the room, so it was not the end of the world. If you look and book far enough a head, you can get same price as the 'Century Plaza' for a nicer more updated, cleaner hotel in the vicinity, since we booked last minute trip, we ended up with the 'Plaza' that offered better price, but not a good deal. Apart from that, Vancouver is an amazing city, so amazing I almost forgot all about the "Plaza Experience".

Reviews.Title: “So helpful, obliging, courteous”
Reviews.Author: florian33
Reviews.Content: Had extended stay here due to volcanic ash! Staff could not have been more helpful; front desk stff made checking in/out fast efficient and friendly; provided print -outs of routes to various places; stored luggage when we went on overnight stay in Victoria; were concerned at the inconvenience the re-routing of aircraft had caused us. Food was delicious; cafe beyond was cheerful and supplied good coffee and internet facility. View from delightful room was impressive and tea/coffee replenished plentifully. Comfortable beds and cheerful room maid. Couldn't have wished for a better place to be stranded!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: BC_island_gal
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 28th floor in a room with a fabulous view. Very reasonable rate. King size bed with a really cute kitchen. The bathroom could use updating but very clean. The restaurant food was excellent, and the morning breakfast room service was on-time and tasty. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Too bad you have to pay for internet, but that seems to be the norm these days. Room had a window to let the fresh air in, which I certainly appreciated. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly-ish. Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: henrysperson
Reviews.Content: Overall, a good stay here for two days. After some initial snootiness at the front desk -- apparently, I did not inform them I had a dog. This is true, but there was nowhere on the reservation website that asked me for that info. And they are registered on 'Pets Can Stay' as dog friendly. So, I was a bit taken aback by their pet 'unfriendly'-ness at check-in. But I will say that they upgraded my room just to put me on one of their 'pet friendly' floors and we got a big suite, which I appreciated. Huge room with kitchen, separate bedroom and great view on the 25th floor. Very close to downtown -- pretty much is downtown. But a few dodgy people at night. And the parking lot had large warnings that cars may get broken into -- I guess the $17 a day extra doesn't pay for security? Spa in the hotel. Comedy club downstairs and a bar. Always something happening in the lobby at most hours -- I'd walk the dog late at night and there were lots of people around. Dog park one block west. Anyhow, I'd give them a 7.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with excellent service -- outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: DFHoppin
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Century Plaza while attending a conference nearby. Room was very basic but everything worked. Good restaurant. Service was excellent throughout my stay -- everyone from the front desk staff to the housekeeper was friendly and seemed to genuinely care. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat it - high price / performace ratio!”
Reviews.Author: lilyipper
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with the price, especially if you've booked online via expedia or aircanada.com (about the same prices). Booked a week stay at $118 per night for a one bedroom corner suite (room 2003). The apartment is spacious with a 48" plasma tv, two beds in the room and a pull out couch in the living room. The building is dated but they have done a good job to upgrade where they could to improve the look at feel. We have nice cherry cabinets in the kitchen a laminate countertops while the bathroom has a nice granite countertop. The room also boasts crown molding , black out curtains and over very warm decor. Oh, did I mention location? We were staying her to be close to St. Paul's hospital where my grandma is at, but at the same time, so close to the dinner action on Burrard and the shopping district. Minutes from the Canada line that takes you to YVR airport. I'd definitely stay here again and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Jasper-2002
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here and we found it still very good value, it is a pity we don't have suite hotels of this standard in major UK cities. The food was excellent and reception and doorman we very obliging. It is great to have such a large suite for so little cash.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad considering how much I paid...”
Reviews.Author: TOinTO
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about this hotel based on the reviews I read. The only reason why I booked a reservation at this hotel was because of the location and the cost of a room for less than a $100/night. The lobby is quite nice and the customer service at the front desk was fine. The hotel room I was assigned to was adequate. It was quite large with a huge king size bed and a couch. I'm not sure why there was a microwave and a empty bar fridge (a stocked fridge would've been nice) but the decor was from the 1970s. The was a hint of cigarette smell in the air once I entered into it (I asked for a non smoking room) and there were a few stains on the carpet. It would've been nice if I could access the internet in my room rather than having to venture to the lobby and I was annoyed at the knock on the door at 9 am from the housekeeping service asking when I was leaving (check out is at 11 am - can't I stay till then?). Would I stay here again - the jury is out on that one. I'm not sure if anyone could find a nicer hotel for the same amount of money. BTW - the hotel is located next to Vancouver's major downtown hospital - expect noise and lots of sirens.

Reviews.Title: “poor reservation service and response”
Reviews.Author: Galonsky
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite from what appeared to be their website. I expalined to the person at the booking office that I wanted a suite big enough for three adults and 3 small children. We were coming form Toronto and my daughter was coming from the Yukon. A family reunion. OK. No problem. Got to the hotel and first night OK. Big suite and we got 2 cots. Next day reservation managwer called. Get out too many people in the suite..At least two would have to leave. She said i did not book through the hotel - it was Expedia. She would take not rsponsibility even though she confirmed the reservation personally by Email. By some bizarre kind of thought process although they used Expedia you could book a herd of elephants - until presumably you got to the room. Neither she nor the manager of the hotel would negotiate a price on another room so we packed up and found a another hotel The Listel which was a better location and extremely accomodating. Poor PR to say the least. Merry Xmas!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: katiederham
Reviews.Content: Century Plaza was the only hotel on Expedia in our price range, so we expected to end up somewhere rather shabby. However, we were very pleasantly suprised when we arrived there! The hotel is in a great location, and the lobby is beautiful. The rooms are large and spacious, and beds are very comfortable. Breakfast was not included in our rate, but was available for a very reasonable price. Wifi was available for free in the lobby but not in the rooms. For the price, the hotel is an excellent choice in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “meh”
Reviews.Author: darban
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a girls night out, the front desk guy was creepy. The only good things about this hotel is the location and the view (we were on the 25th floor). The hotel boasts that it is recentley updated, but the carpets and paint are already looking well worn. Definitley not worth the $450. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Sagebrush
Reviews.Content: Nothing spectacular about this hotel and the rooms are getting a bit tired. However, they were clean and fairly roomy for the price. Convenient to downtown. The comedy club in the basement proved to be a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: biaci
Reviews.Content: We stayed there the last week of October and stayed in an Executive Suite in the upper 29th level. The view over the city was fantastic, but the noise very disturbing, also given the fact that a hospital was next door. The room was very big but interior not the latest and walls could do with some refurbishings; a night lamp was missing in our bedroom as well as a closet to hang up some clothes. Nevertheless we enjoyed the space and the kingsize bed was okay. The sink in the bathroom looked nice but was completely unhandy for real use :-( The restaurant & bar were very good and service attentive in the evening, in the mornings - once you showed your breakfast vouchers to choose from either eggs & hashbrowns, waffle or pancakes with coffee - the service was a bit abrasive. One thing that annoyed a bit was that WiFi was only available in the lobby area and no complimentary computers around for guests; the only option were the public computers in the adjoining coffee bar (6 $ per hour). We did not experience the Spa as the prices seemed pretty high compared to average Canadian prices for food and else so even in Euro it seemed pretty much. However, the hotel is within walking distance to waterfront, Granville Island, famous Robson shopping street and various nice restaurants so can totally recommend it location-wise.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Prowe1051
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Century Plaza on a recent visit to Vancouver. We found the staff friendly and caring, the room was large, clean and complete with all the amenties. The location is as central as you can get and handy to most downtown Vancouver sites. We will definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “deserves a "10"”
Reviews.Author: lalynda
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt....this hotel was one of the finest experiences of our month long vacation. from the unrequsted upgrade to a suite on the 24th floor to the care and consideration we were given, by everyone....every day.....there has to be something better than a "5"

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: nmeredith
Reviews.Content: Staff on evening check in was pleasant and friendly. Encounters with day staff found them to be rude and unhelpful. Room, just ok, it was dated but clean; furniture in room was worn and lighting was not great; room lamps were old and did not work well.Noise from street was loud-close to hospital so lots of sirens. Wireless in room did not work well and complaints to staff received indifference and it was a $9.00 charge. Use the free wireless in lobby. Location close to shopping and restaurants, easy walking to many attractions. Food in restaurant good, expensive, service just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: BelindaO
Reviews.Content: The service and food in the Beyond Blue Resturaunt was fantastic. The rooms were spacious and very comfortable. Very clean and very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, Spacious and very warm staff”
Reviews.Author: chuaDelhi
Reviews.Content: The location is very central and since we were travelling with children needed a larger room. This hotel did not dissapoint and the service far exceeded our expectations, we will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: lwilky
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and we can't think of a bad thing to say about it. Everything was better then anything we could have asked for. The hotel staff went out of their way to help us out and were always very friendly. This hotel is located perfectly, it's within walking distance to just about anything you could possibly need. The rooms are large and very clean. I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I'm ever in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “From A to Z just a solid hotel and would not stay anywhere else in Vancover for the price!”
Reviews.Author: BwanaSwahili
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Vancouver. Spent a lot of time on the computer researching for hotels and for the price I choose The Century Plaza. Was moving my newly graduated college daughter there to live. She did not have a place to live or work when we arrived. The staff at the hotel basically adopted us and with their help I left 8 days later with my daughter settled in to a great apartment with a wonderful job. You just do not find these kind of helpful people often (the entire hotel staff). My room was very large (Studio Suite) with a great view and everything in it that I could ask for. The restaurant and bar were outstanding! I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ahmazing
Reviews.Content: The Century Plaza is in an excellent, central location. Its just blocks from Robson. I would definitely stay at the Plaza on my next trip to Vancouver. The hotel was hip without being obnoxious or snobby. We stayed on the 18th floor and had a nice view of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “You can pay alot less for alot better elsewhere!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sugarcake86
Reviews.Content: Well, let me start by saying that I will never stay at the century plaza again! This is my second stay at this hotel, only because everything else was fully booked. They tried to put us in a different room than what we ordered, then charged us extra to upgrade because they had given away the room we actually booked. The glasses in the room were all filthy, obvious scum in the bottoms. We had to ask for bar soap. When having a shower, the tap continues to run full force, filling up the bathtub at the same time the showerhead is going. There are no ice machines in this hotel, you have to go to the lounge and ask the bartender for ice, who is extremely rude about it. You are only allowed one bucket per night! They charge you $9.00 per 24hours for wireless internet. Most other hotels in Van offer it at no charge. On top of all that, they tried to charge us for bottled water they claimed we drank, when there wasn't even any in the room/ fridge. The room was fairly spacious, and the location is ideal, but that is about it. I visit Vancouver often, and there are several less expensive, cleaner, better hotels with exceptional service. I DO NOT recommend the century plaza hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value, service, lobby and location but rooms are tired.”
Reviews.Author: NEGlobeTrotter_9
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed in a suite and we were given 2 rollaways at no additional cost. Everything about this hotel is awesome for a short term stay in Vancouver. The lobby is ultra modern and the staff was very professional but it was a bit of a let down when we steppped off of the elevator upstairs. Carpets are quite worn and paint is visibly chipping on sills, etc. That said, the price was way too good to complain. We loved the comfortable beds and the highest pressure shower on earth. This hotel has great beds and the

Reviews.Title: “Fine and Handy - smashing value”
Reviews.Author: SkigerstaBear
Reviews.Content: Fairly basic, but clean. kitchen facilities in the room as well. Good location, within walking distance to most things downtown Vancouver. Good option if going self catering, eating in the hotel or eating out. We only had foo din teh hotel one night night and it was very nice - very smart bar. We woudl definately stay in the Century Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: darksecret1
Reviews.Content: Gosh I lost count how many times we stayed at this hotel (maybe 4 times already?) Anyhow, we always get the junior suites that the hotel. Decent sized kitchen, nice bedroom, lovely balcony...I agree, tv's are small, but who cares? we come to Vancouver to see the city, not what's on tv... (I've seen their "average" rooms and they're just 'ok'. I think management knows they need remodelling so little by little you see them being reworked). I think once they're done with contruction (which I am sure they'll be working hard to finish before the 2010 Olympics, this hotel will get a major facelift in rooms other than the junior suites).

Reviews.Title: “It has gone downhill in service, quality and up in price.”
Reviews.Author: TheTravellerCAN
Reviews.Content: Ive have stayed with this hotel, on business over 20 years. My last 2 visits June 2008- May 2009 were less than average. Floors below 24. Front desk missed some paperwork, phoned my room and DEMANED, I come down rather than they send a valet with paperwork. Some kitchen utensils were filthy, no cleaning of 3-day old blot on kitchen floor, bed was rock hard and narrow, furniture is very used, dented, worn (12 yrs plus). Internet $ 7.95 CND per day, noisy guests 03:30am upstairs, rooms are not sound proof for outside noise, (and there is a lot of outside noise) air-conditioning is extra $$, heat does not work as needed, room cleaner inexperienced by lack of washroom upkeep, check-out person refused to move "bill" two extra feet along desk so I could sign as other were still in line, indiferent to calling valet for baggage check, lobby is not that hot just as the hyped main restaurant personel are more interested in what you think of them, their opinions versus your questions. Unless your a fake, wastefull type this place is not worth the price, these days. Never going back there, after 20 years, its is all downhill with them .....

Reviews.Title: “Not enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: poopy55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a night. Staff at the hotel did not have a good attitude and seemed very condescending when dealing with customer concerns. Very poor customer service and did NOT feel very welcome. Room were decent, however furniture seemed very outdated. Television set was the smallest tv ive ever seen in any hotel room. Very slow elevator. took literally 5 minutes to get to the 20th floor. VERY uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Pool ceiling is gorgeous!!”
Reviews.Author: lmbrennen
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to book because I read that the pool was closed.. I am a waterbaby and love to swim! But wow what a gorgeous ceiling they've put in place. It's all in silver, a sort of basket-weave effect. Very neat to look at when you're in there. I've attached a camera-phone pic.. it's a bit grainy but gives you the idea!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get a refurbished room if you stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ssbCalgary
Reviews.Content: The first room I got was very depressing and I couldn't imagine staying in it. I paid extra and got a refurbished suite on the 27th floor that was pretty good.(I think anything above the 25th floor is redone). Everything was new and it had a decent view with a balcony. If you have a fear of elevators you may not like the small rickety elevators, I know I didn't. The hotel is very mediocre considering you can stay across the street at the Sheraton for around the same price with ten times the ambiance and amenities. If you need a suite I guess it's OK and the location is good. It was clean but I have no desire to stay there again. I was booked for 7 nights but left after 2 because the pool was under construction.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location!”
Reviews.Author: gmaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: Great big room (however, furnitures not so modern) ! Nice restaurant/bar!

Reviews.Title: “A Test at Best”
Reviews.Author: Sugar55Squamish
Reviews.Content: January 16th - I was attending a special conference in Vancouver and decided at the last moment to overnight in the city due to poor road and weather conditions. I found the Century Plaza website (this hotel was close to my event) and booked an available suite at the Seasonal Special Rate of $109.00 per night. I recorded my confirmation and customer numbers and looked forward to a nice relaxing stay. January 17th - I called the hotel from the conference to inquire about parking and to confirm my reservation. I identified myself to the person that answered the phone, told him I would be checking in around 5pm and offered my confirmation info. He hurriedly told me he didn't require my confirmation numbers and that everything was taken of. At 5:15pm (dinner break from the conference) I arrived to check-in. There was no record of my reservation. I was told that the fax (?) was probably locked in the office which closed on Friday at 5pm so the desk didn't get it. There was a room available at a rate of $119.00 a night and I was given a $10 breakfast coupon. Tired and rushed I took the room and signed in. Room 1605 reeked of smoke and other unsavoury things. The funishings were dated , broken and dirty. The linen was clean. There was no Parking Valet on duty, so I had to park my car myself in the dark, seedy lot behind the hotel. On check out the next day the bill seemed a bit high. When I asked about it I found out that I had been charged $129.00 for the room and because I had signed the check in and didn't notice the discrepancy nothing could be done. The desk staff were at best indifferent and certainly not accomodating. The breakfast was good, but the whole experience left a bad taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Getting Older”
Reviews.Author: CathiM
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Century Plaza a few times over the years and it is definitely showing it's age. I agree with the other reviewers that once you get past the shiny reception area the aging of this hotel does show. I unfortunately stayed on the smoking floor, a very generous yield to my sisters vice. The smell of the floor hits you when the elevator doors open, thank goodness the stove in the kitchenette had a good overhead fan. The room was shabby and I never did figure out how to heat the chilly room, you could hear the wind whistling in around the windows and we were only on the 7th floor. There is wireless in room internet but it costs you. The joy of being situated around St Paul's never changes, the ambulance sirens lull you to sleep and you truly experience the despairing sight of homelessness and drug abuse. The restaurant was nice and the menu was a reasonable price and quality but we only ate breakfast there. The doorman is a nice but I am sure necessary touch as the elevators are not room card locked. This is probably the last time I will stay there, as someone has already said there are lots of hotels to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mapleridge5
Reviews.Content: My husband ended up in ICU at St Paul's just after Christmas and I needed a place to stay that was close, clean and reasonably priced. The staff at Century Plaza were excellent in getting me into a room that night and accommodating my subsequent 3 week stay. They gave me a preferred rate and waived the additional amount they would have made on a New Years rate. The staff were gracious, helpful and courteous. They made an extremely difficult time in my life and my childrens life easier. I cannot say enough good things about the people in this hotel from the housekeepers to the doormen to the front desk staff, all were fantastic. I will remember this hotel and refer it to all of my friends who come to town. Thank you Century Plaza!

Reviews.Title: “Very Dirty-Don't Let The Lobby Fool You”
Reviews.Author: travelgal067
Reviews.Content: We booked a king, smoking room, when we got into the room, the smell was like nothing I have ever smelled in my life, I looked for a dead body in the closet. The King room looked like a crack den and smelled no better, very very dirty from top to bottom...We called the front desk and they changed our room to a non smoking suite, which was still dirty, but miles better than the first room. They gave us a coupon to use in the restaurant (as part of the deal when we booked)...the restaurant was booked to capacity with 2 different christmas parties so we were not able to use our coupon. The one good thing I have to say about this hotel is the staff...they were second to none, very very accommodating with our room change and my constant phone calls for towels, glasses, ice etc. Lastly, the pool area....FILTHY, FILTHY FILTHY...change rooms, no towels, terrible showers and again...FILTHY.

Reviews.Title: “Shangrila From the 21st Floor”
Reviews.Author: Friendlyfrank
Reviews.Content: I needed to travel from a small town to Vancouver to have my 6 month checkup for my new valve at the hospital nearby. I was excited to see the hotel after having read reviews both good and bad on the net and stared at all the pictures. I was not surprised neither with the convenience of in-and-out parking right there nor the shining beauty of the comfortable lobby-then they told me I was being upgraded for nothing to the honeymoon suite on the 21st floor. Well, what can I say? i had to be dragged off the balcony where I watched twinkling xmas lights, city lights, ships on the water-my own little Shangrila! In the morning I was back there staring into the daylight world and ordered in a very reasonably priced breakfast. The coffee in the room was good. I can't wait for my next checkup- I stepped out a side door of the hotel and into the side door of the hosital right across the street, PS photos to follow.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Maritza79
Reviews.Content: This place is horrible, don't get fooled by the reception, the restaurant and the website. Everything in the first floor is nice and new but once you get to your room everything is very old and smelly, the comforter on the beds like they never been washed.. the fridge stinks, the sofas are so dirty and smell bad absolutely bad. don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “Hired the wrong manager to run the place”
Reviews.Author: narfgirl
Reviews.Content: I have to commend the staff for being very polite at the check in. However, when I had to speak to a manager regarding an issue, he used strong words and had his security involved which escalated the situation. For the $200 I spent to book the night, I was only allowed to stay for 3 hours and a refund wasn't offered. Having travelled many countries around the world, I've never encountered this kind of treatment especially in the hospitality industry. I can't justify the success of this establishment under the management of Denis --.

Reviews.Title: “worth the off season price”
Reviews.Author: dockgirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here as well as two other couples. We had a standard room, one other couple had a junior suite and the other had the executive king. we were all generally happy with our stay with a few issues. The carpets could definitely use a cleaning, you have to go all the way to the lobby with your ice bucket and get ice from the restaurant there. They charge you for each local call out of the hotel. It looks like there's complimentary water for you on the counter and in the fridge but if you read the tag on the bottles it says you will be charged $3.50 each if you drink them, so don't just get all excited and start opening one up like my friend did. Every suite has a kitchen but no dishes. you get glasses and cutlery though. Overall it was a typical stay for the off season prices but I can't see it being worth full price. Great location and the views are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: motoguzzi-cruiser
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Rooms are ok if you get an refurbished one with air condition. The corridors are dark and small and the elevators are very old. Windows open a with a little gap. Staff was ok and room was clean and reasonable sized.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: attik
