Reviews.Content: We were very impressed by this hotel. The price was reasonable in comparison to similar hotels that we looked at. The staff was extremely helpful. The rooms were clean. All rooms are suites, so rather large and comfortable. It is a little noisy, but the hotel is in the middle of a large city, so that is to be expected. The location is excellent and serviced by two hop on and off tourist bus services. You can also walk to just about any location in downtown Vancouver. We got a taxi to the airport for four people and lots of luggage for $25.00! Only negative I can think of is that the rooms are getting to the point of needing renovations (tears in drapes, stains on carpet, scratches on walls...) but still a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault the Century Plaza”
Reviews.Author: mitzipeb
Reviews.Content: Stayed 13 nights at the Century Plaza End August/Beg.Sept 2008 and enjoyed the experience - all the staff were professional and friendly. Our room was a corner one on the 18th floor and afforded views down/side of Burrard Street, especially lovely when lights came on over the city at night. Any requests to staff were attended to immediately. The Beyond Restaurant/lounge was a very relaxing place to have a meal. There was siren noise from ambulances, etc. in the street below but I guess this noise is heard all over the city wherever one stays. Perhaps it is heard more in the locality of the Century Plaza as there is an Emergency Hospital nearby. We would certainly return to this hotel if ever in Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience at the Century”
Reviews.Author: redhead1953
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 28th floor by chance (the lower floors were already booked) and, after reading the negative reviews of the lower floors, I'd say that was a good thing. My wife and I received friendly, attentive service from the hotel staff from the moment we drove in including the bellhop, front desk clerk and concierge (and even the staff person who gave me the Internet ID and password). The room was large, clean and comfortable. Everything worked including the shower and TV. We had views of ships in the bay. It was nice having a full kitchen instead of the usual microwave and dorm refrig. There were some negatives, of course, but we compensated. Elevator noise could be heard from the bedroom and may have made sleep difficult, however we ALWAYS sleep with earplugs when away. The sheets in the bed have way too much polyester and are not fitted-it's a pet peeve of mine to have the bottom sheet come completely untucked and ride halfway up the bed so part of me is sleeping on the mattress in the morning.....

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families and long stays!”
Reviews.Author: andytan94
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Vancouver for seven days in summer and booked the hotel without breaking the bank!! The One Bedroom suite was spacious for us travelling with 2 children. We appreciated the full kitchen facilities and there is a grocery store nearby. Room had a toaster and kitchen utensils. The balcony allowed us to enjoy some great views. The staffs were very warm and friendly. We visited the spa on a rainy day and enjoyed being pampered. We will return next year

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you get on the "right" floor”
Reviews.Author: amlazyAlabama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Century Plaza from July 9th to July 13, 2008. We selected the hotel because it was the only central location where we could book a one bedroom suite with 2 beds in the bedroom and a sleeper sofa in the living room. This was a girl's trip with 3 of us so that combination worked best. We called ahead and requested a renovated room. We did not get a renovated (floors 25 and up) room but were given a 1 bedroom corner suite on the 24th floor. The view from the suite was terrific. I don't think it could be beat by many other locations in Vancouver. It was also very spacious. The furnishings and linens were a little dated but the hotel staff made up for much of this by going out of their way to fill every request. We did get a glimpse of the hallway leading to some of the lower floor rooms while riding the elevator. The hall carpet on these floors appeared very worn and the halls had a distinctive unpleasant odor... Overall I would recommend the hotel for the great location, spaciousness, and value if you can be sure to get a room on one of the upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Nena12345
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the hotel many times in the past, but this time was terrible. Bellmen and restaurant/bar staff are wonderful. That's about it. The rooms are very run down, shower doesn't work properly, bathtub is stained, TV is broken, etc. etc. We booked this months ago and when we checked in we got a room directly over Burrard Street, which is extremely noisy with sirens and homeless people yelling in the middle of the night. The front desk staff were abrupt and rude. Asked for a password to access internet and the clerk said "What, you want it NOW?". Noticed that the checkout date was incorrectly entered on our form, and another clerk said, "This is why you're supposed to read it before you sign it." Then when we checked out they misplaced the receipt faxed to them earlier that indicated it was a prepaid room. I had to spend over half an hour getting it refaxed to them. The desk clerk simply wanted to charge my visa and not deal with it any longer. Seriously, for the same price, you can stay at the Sheraton across the street for much better service and cleaner rooms. We'll never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for spacious suite”
Reviews.Author: DizzyOAP
Reviews.Content: We had a suite on the 20th floor - actually a very spacious one-bed apartment with good views of the city, and side view of harbour from the balcony. It was great to have all that space at the end of a 3-week trip. The lobby was bright and modern, with an inexpensive cafe. We were told our room had been renovated - probably, apart from the shabby bathroom door and the ancient cooker. The hotel is a 15min walk from the waterfront, but opposite the Sheraton Wall Centre where the city buses stop. Very helpful porters too.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: zilgml
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Century Plaza, along with two other couples, on May 18th. Our rooms were on the 30th floor, very clean, with lovely views of the city. The hotel employees provided excellent service. We enjoyed a lovely breakfast at the hotel. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Compared to other properties in the same area, the cost of this hotel was very reasonable. zilgml

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, great location”
Reviews.Author: AllisonTuck
Reviews.Content: Location: Great. About a 10 min walk to the main street packed with shops, bars and restaurants Room: Good. Massive 'suite' room with 2 kingsized beds, lounge with sofas, kitchen, large well fitted bathroom, tea & coffee, lots of storage. Clean and comfortable but the decor was a little dated. Brilliant views over Vancouver from the 11th floor. Hotel: Impressive contemporary reception, modern lounge, great bar, nice restaurant serving a decent breakfast. Well equipped spa and relaxing pool. We didn't have time to check out the comedy club but would have liked to. Friendly staff and faultless service. Overall: Great location, good facilities and impressively large rooms. Little bit dated but excellent value for money. I would definitely stay there again and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I had expected”
Reviews.Author: mtlcatcher
Reviews.Content: I wish I had checked out this site before booking the Century Plaza. My partner and I stayed there for one week at the end of march. I am a native Vancouverite, and remember this hotel from the 80`s. On arrival it would appear that they had made extensive renovations. However, from what we experienced the renovations were limited to the lobby only. When I booked online I was quite specific about 2 points. The room must be a smoking room and must be high up to have a good view. Vancouver is a stunning city. When we arrived we found that the only smoking floor is the 7th, the bottom of the 25 or so guest floors. The view was of the parking lot and back alley. In the Hallway the paintwork and wallpaper were severly worn. The rooms, while spacious were spartan. The bed was completely uncomfortable, and the plumbing was a nightmare. If you turned on the cold water in the kitchen you couldn`t speak over all the noise. We were awoken each morning by the sound of the shower next door. The plumbing is seriously outdated in this place. The shower was nice and strong but the curtain too short and we subsequently flooded the bathroom several times.While we had a good rate, we could have done better. This place is great if you are on a serious budget, don`t expect much, and are a non smoker. Otherwise, unless you like being treated as a sub-human avoid this place. On a final curious note my partner and I both have crewcut hair, yet each day I found long dark hairs in the bath. Strange

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: holidaydory
Reviews.Content: This hotel appeared very nice upon check in but when I arrived in the hallway of the floor I was on it was shabby and filled with smoke like something out of a Cheech and Chong movie. I had requested a non-smoking room. The room itself was spacious but not fancy. The hotel Management is appalling - they have a very superior attitude towards their guests. I have travelled extensively and usually stay in hotels a few weeks of every year. I have to say this will stand out in my mind as the worst experience I have ever had. I would not recommend this hotel for a dog to stay in. There are many beautiful hotels in Vancouver, this is not one of them..

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the Century Plaza”
Reviews.Author: sunwor
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an affordable hotel in the downtown Vancouver area. I did a lot of research on Trip Advisor and finally settled for the Century Plaza Hotel. It was a great location, on the 12th floor with a view and it costs less than $90.00. Also, I received a $10.00 voucher to use in their restaurant. The hotel was exactly how I pictured it to be, judging by the other reviews. The lobby was very fancy, but the room was not. It was dated, with older carpet and couch but it was great value. The room was very large with separate living room, small kitchen table and stove and fridge. The bedroom was average and the bathroom a bit on the small side. The room was quite, centrally located, clean, and the front desk help was very friendly and efficient. All in all, I was very happy and would absolutely stay here again. I used the $10.00 voucher for breakfast, so basically ate for free. The food and service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great facilities”
Reviews.Author: sarah2626
Reviews.Content: Really loved this hotel. The décor in the room was not terribly modern but the suite had plenty of space and all the facilities that anyone could need. This was really great value for money. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Denali National Park and Preserve, Alaska
Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: trilobite01
Reviews.Content: The former reviews are correct. A grand lobby, but the guest rooms aren't too grand. Pretty simple. But no problems. The food from room service was excellent. 50% of the staff were great, the other half were obnoxious. Sheets were in very poor condition. (Paper thin). However, It was really a nice stay. I like that the rooms are suites, very large. Nice pool (no hot tub) and steam room. (Internet is NOT free)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: chrissie_uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Century Plaza for four nights in the middle of a tour through Canada and Alaska. The hotel is tall and narrow, only 10 bedrooms on each of the 30 floors. It has a very smart entrance lobby. The staff on the Reception desk were brilliant and very helpful. The “Beyond” Restaurant and Café Plaza are situated at ground level. The Beyond Restaurant is open from 6.30 a.m. to 12.00 a.m., the Café Plaza is open for a variety of salads, sandwiches and snacks from 7.00 a.m. to 6.00 p.m. Our room, No: 1806, was on the 18th floor with terrific views over Vancouver. The rooms are enormous with two double beds, bedside table lamps, chest and small wardrobe in the bedroom area. The TV swivels between the bedroom area and the lounge area which has a very comfortable three seater settee, one long and one square coffee table with reading lamp. There is a small dining table and two chairs, a kitchenette with large fridge with freezing compartment, a four ring electric cooker, microwave, coffee maker, electric kettle and toaster. Washing up liquid and tea towels are provided. A small, but adequate, bathroom with towels, facecloths, shampoo, conditioner and hairdryer together with very good air conditioning complete the picture. Safety deposit boxes are available at the front desk free of charge. The menu in the room is fairly comprehensive and the daily paper is delivered free of charge each morning. Body massage, hairdressing and body treatments are available as is a steam room and swimming pool. The pool is a reasonable size but, unlike the rest of the hotel, it looks a bit run down and in need of a face lift. On arrival we decided to go to the bar for a glass of wine – big mistake. We were giving a minute amount of wine in a very large glass and we were charged $18 [£8.35] for two!!! We did not eat in the hotel as it is fairly expensive and there are numerous cafes and restaurants within walking distance. There is a grocery store a couple of minutes walk away which we used to buy breakfast ingredients. Tea and coffee is provided in the rooms. As we had been travelling we decided to send some items to the laundry but the maid told us there was a laundry on one of the lower floors which turned out be be very efficient. She brought us an ironing board and iron and left it with us for the duration of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: indiehotel
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Vancouver, and we chose the Century Plaza for the price and also after reading some Trip Advisor reviews. We found it very good value for money for a downtown hotel. Our room was very clean and spacious with two double beds, a sofa, coffee table, and fully equipped kitchen. The hotel is well located within ten minutes walk of Burrard Station for the Skytrain, and is also close to Robson, the main shopping street. You will also find a plethora of restaurants in the area, around Davie Village, Robson Street and so on. There is a supermarket five minutes down the road if you wish to stock your fridge with supplies. The only downside is that the rooms do get very hot at night, however the hotel do provide both a standing fan and an airconditioning unit. Opening the windows at night is not a good idea as it gets very noisy with police and fire sirens. Also, if you want to be on a high floor and get good views of the city, it is best to book directly with the hotel. We asked for a high floor through an online agent and paid up front, but on arrival were told that a higher floor would cost an extra $30CAN per night, which we were not prepared to pay at that stage. However, we would definitely choose the Century Plaza again, as it is well located, has very helpful staff, a great bar/restaurant, and is more like an apartment block than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More positive than negative !”
Reviews.Author: sunless_n_seattle
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vancouver frequently and have stayed in many downtown properties and just returned from a stay at Century Plaza. I'd consider this a 3+ star hotel. Great lobby and lobby bar, good womens steam/locker room, great restaurant, friendly staff, convenient parking, best location. After checking all rates i found the suites here the largest for the price. We reserved an execuite king suite and friends had adjoining 2 bed room with kitchenette [$99!!!]. We both had amazing views and recently remodeled rooms [all above 25] on the upper floor. Spa looked nice but didn't have time to indulge. TIP: Hotel matched webs lower rates and upper north view is best.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by this Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: BizTravellerHalifax
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the worst hotel experiences we have had traveling on business throughout Canada. The hotel staff tried to work with us to fix the issues we encountered, but try as they might the overall condition of this hotel prevented their best efforts in being enough. The first room had two single beds, whose mattresses had seen much better days, the springs were clearly coming through and they were dirty and falling apart. They attempted to put foam and extra blankets but this had little to no effect and at 189.00 per night, the overall condition of the room matched the bed including holes in the curtains, appliances that were clearly left over from when this was an apartment building more than 35 years ago. After much searching they up graded us (with additional charge) to a King supposedly upgraded suite it was some what better, with newer furniture but the king bed had a very cheap mattress, ripped blankets and the pull out sofa bed was almost impossible to sleep in due to lack of support. We were not able to find any other hotel due to lack of hotel space in the city, or we would have moved ASAP. The staff was clearly not surprised at our complaints indicating that this was something they heard all the time. Overall if you have any other option in staying in Vancouver take it, do not be fooled by the nice lobby area and updated entry. The pool area is covered with mold and I would not recommend using it due to lack of cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, central location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: suevinales
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really well located - around the corner from Robson Street and 5 minutes from the Art Gallery. We were in a suite - very comfortable and spacious. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. This was our last stay in our trip through Canada and we would have loved to stay a few more days!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SnMagician
Reviews.Content: Date 7/24/07 TripAdvisor member from Savannah, GA. Our check-in and out were handled efficiently and correctly. The room was as promised, a king study. There was a sofa, a wet bar area, with a small refrigerator. The bathroom was appointed nicely. The hotel was convenient to the downtown area, a short cab ride to the cruise ship departures. We had breakfast in the restaurant downstairs and it was excellent. We would stay here again !!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, no air conditioning!!!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleStef
Reviews.Content: The lobby was gorgeous, which is why the state of our standard room was so alarming. Horribly filthy carpet, no air-conditioning (we were offered a fan) and the bed felt like it had rocks in it. The hotel should have used some of the money they spent on the beautiful lobby on the guestrooms. I am perplexed by 4 & 5 star reviews here, I assume those guests had one of the executive, high priced rooms?

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Roadtripper12
Reviews.Content: The Century Plaza is within walking distance to Gastown if you don't mind a little stroll. In a neat area of Vancouver. Easy to get to. The hotel is clean, but the lobby area is much more nicely decorated than the rooms themselves I think. When you see the hotel and walk into the lobby, it is modern, fresh and artistic. The rooms themselves appear old and left more to be desired. It felt as if the rooms and the lobby did not belong together at all. The view from our room was nice, and the room seemed pretty clean. It had a kitchenette, which we didn't ask for or think we got with our reservation but they didn't charge us any more. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful with directions. We would stay here again, mainly because of the cleanliness, location, and price. Next time I would like to try out their spa too, I heard that it is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Bendtraveler24
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews about the construction, I was hesitant to go through with my booking. I looked at their website and found out which floors were finished with the remodeling (they are going from the top down). When I went back to the website I was booking through, I discovered they were specifically mentioning which floors went with each rate and decided to go ahead and book. Since this hotel is a regular stop on the airport shuttle, it was very easy to get to and from the airport. My room has nice and clean. My only complaint with housekeeping is that I had a room on the west side and they would open up the curtains I purposely closed when I left for the day. When I would get back to my room it was VERY HOT from the afternoon sun and it would take awhile for the air conditioning to cool it down. I also received vouchers for breakfast with my booking and I was very happy with the selection and service.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Hagrinas
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed results about this hotel, I was a bit apprehensive. The hotel looked nice on the web, but not everybody agreed that it was really like that. The first thing I found was that the staff was very friendly, and very helpful. The asst. front desk manager, John Clark, went out of his way to be helpful to a greater extent than any manager I can remember. I stayed in a suite on the 28th floor. Although I didn't see the other types of rooms, except for fleeting glimpses when they were being made up, I certainly can't complain about the renovated suites. They are nice suites with all the amenities I needed. And when I did need something extra, such as more dishes, housekeeping was amazingly accommodating. The restaurant is very good, although there are many restaurants nearby to choose from, often at better prices. But if you want the convenience of eating at the hotel or ordering room service, you will get good food and service. The location could not be better. It's centrally located and near many attractions. Although there is a moderate amount of traffic noise at certain hours, it was not enough to be a problem. The swimming pool area was adequate, but its room could use a new paint job. Also, the chlorine level was a bit too high. But the facilities, including the locker room, which had a steam room and showers with a head on top and three on the side were nice enough that even on days I did not swim, they were preferable places for a relaxing shower. However, there is no gym at the hotel. The parking lot is convenient, but they do charge for it. Internet access costs money, which is typical of all but low priced hotels, but one could be misled by the website and expect it to be included. I mentioned this to the manager, who was glad to get helpful feedback, and the web page will be probably be updated soon to be clearer. The windows open, and there is a balcony, and the air conditioner works well if you prefer to keep the windows closed. Whatever minor inconveniences I found, the hotel staff was anxious to accommodate. I needed to leave a couple of days early, and Expedia's rules required a stiff penalty since I did not cancel them prior to my first day. The manager went out of his way to assure that I got a full refund anyway, since I gave several days' notice, and made sure that Expedia would give me the refund. There may be swankier hotels in the area, but this one met my needs very well, and especially well for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mirraFlorida
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, friendly staff and comfortable rooms. We stayed there prior to going on an Alaska cruise. The room we had was comfortable and spacious with a separate work area and internet connection. The restaurant in the hotel has great breakfasts. Part of our luggage was lost, but when it arrived it was delivered promptly to our room. The staff was great about giving us directions and recommendations about what to do. The hotel is currently undergoing a renovation. We stayed in a renovated room. Make sure you ask for this when making your reservation. There definitely was a difference. The hotel is walking distance from Yaletown where you can enjoy great jazz and fantastic food. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bigperm86
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights of our honeymoon and were definitely impressed. I booked online through the hotel's website and they have a price match so I called after booking and they met the expedia price. We had a King Suite, great view of the city, nice large living areas, fridge, good water pressure and good AC unit. Very impressive lobby, even though we did not eat at the restaurant. Davie street right around the corner had a ton of good places to eat. Everything is walkable from this hotel and the area is good. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: SouthAfricaTraveller
Reviews.Content: The reception is beautiful and modern. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The room was great. We were given a suite with a lounge, bedroom and a kitchen with a microwave. It was clean and neat and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely dirty rooms!”
Reviews.Author: USA_trekker
Reviews.Content: Pros: Lobby is exceptionally clean and gorgeous - almost looks like a 5 star hotel Very good location Cons: 1. Room carpet is filthy. 2. They charge you extra for parking ($12.5 per night) - they don't even tell you that until you check out. At that time they will say that they are sorry for NOT mentioning that earlier, but there is nothing that they can do about it except for being sorry. Their excuse is that they have new staff. 3. I booked a room with two double beds and got one with a king bed - was very inconvenient for me. They said they were "sorry" but they were completely full. 4. The bathroom fittings are pretty old, and crappy. Overall - I would never go back to this place again. For the amount I paid (plus the parking) I could have gotten a far better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller002
Reviews.Content: We booked a studio room through expedia but when we got there they put us in a room literally ontop of the buildings airconditioning vent. Very Noisy. Also, the room did not come with what it said on Expedia (Kitchen). After bringing this to the hotels attention they moved us into a one bedroom suite. What a change. My wife and I were there for 3 nights and were very happy. It is strange how rooms differed though, but this hotel was in the perfect location between all the attractions. I would recommend getting a one bed suite. Ask for a high room, good vews.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jp12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Mar 9 & 10 and were very pleased. We booked a one bedroom suite and were upgraded to a corner suite. It was on the 18th floor so if it wasn't renovated we didn't care. Yes, there was a little corner of laminate missing from the counter and we had to call for extra towels and linens since there were 2 adults and 2 teenagers; but where else can you get a huge room with a separate bedroom, view of the water and kitchen for about $100 a night? The teenagers swam in the indoor pool and we walked to the water and up to Stanley Park, to Robson street, took the ferry to Granville Island - all without taking the car out of the garage. The desk clerk recommended Stephos - a great Greek restaurant right down the street. I am only surprised that this hotel doesn't have a higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “A good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: El-Cholestero
Reviews.Content: It was our second stay in the hotel; our first having been last summer. The hotel is very centrally located on Burrard, a couple of blocks from Robson, and right on a major bus route. The rooms are mini-suites, which have small kitchenettes. For us, we found it very convenient, since we could buy food at the supermarket that's 2 blocks away. Also, we could buy fresh produce at the Granville Market and keep it in the refridgerator. The rooms are clean, if a bit run down. The front desk staff is efficient, and the bellmen are quite helpful. Considering what some other hotels on Burrard are charging, like the Fairmont or Sutton Place, this hotel is a real bargain. I'd rather stay here and spend the money I save on the food in Vancouver, which is outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: ssitravellers
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel when planning to go to Yuk Yuks(excellent comedy club) to our surprise in was a newly renovated hotel with spa and pool! We had a wonderful room on the 27th floor overlooking Burrard St/ water side, many freight ships all lit up! We had a kitchenette, king size bed, and great shower! Close to shopping on Robson and also a great 'Crepe' restuarant!

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mikeRS
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife spent a week in sept/oct 2006 on a recommendation. To be honest, the hotel was a bit dissapointing. The lobby of the hotel is very smart and this can give you a false sense of what your room/suite might look like....I read that it had been recently refurbished. However the room was disappointing. We booked a non- smoking suite, which stunk of cigarette smoke and was facing, what looked like the alleyway. After we complained, we were soon given another suite on the 20th floor, which faced onto Brurrard Street (opposite the Wall Centre) which gave us a great view of the main street. Our suite was a fair size, with a kitchenette (microwave kettle, fridge ,and cooker) and a table and chairs to eat.Another complaint was the shower which was totally dillapidated, and sqirted everywhere. The drawers in the bedroom, were below par...we used some plastic bags, split open as drawliners to protect our clothes. (The rooms definitely need updating). On the positive side, the Century Plaza was excellently located...we were able to pick up the Vancouver bus tour right outside. (recommended, and you can use the ticket for 2 days!) You could also walk to Robson Street (equivalent to our Oxford Street , but much smaller) in 5 minutes. We also ate at Dennys, which was across the road (recommended for a good breakfast). Our room was clean and tidy, but there are better hotels in cental Vancouver than this one, ...next time, we might try the Sutton Palace Hotel, which is about 50 yards away. Overal 3/5.

Reviews.Title: “Great five day trip”
Reviews.Author: EdmTraveller101
Reviews.Content: Stayed as a solo traveller at the Century Plaza in October 2006 when in Vancouver for five days for a business/leisure trip. Booked the room through the hotel website and got a great deal on a studio suite with a king bed, sofa area, mini kitchenette, and oversized room on a high floor. Requested a smoking room on a high floor as well as a late check out and both requests were accomodated on the reservation. Also arrived earlier than check in and was able to get into the room right on arrival at approximately noon. Thr room was very clean and it appeared that the housekeeping staff took alot of pride in maintaining this. The hotel spa is also great if you're looking for a dayspa. The hotel itself is in a fabulous location, close to Robson Street (two-three blocks) and other tourist spots worth seeing in Vancouver. There is a sky train station about five blocks away, otherwise there are frequent buses right outside the hotel door if you don't feel like walking. Overall a great stay in a great, but less expensive hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: sinatra1234
Reviews.Content: For the price the rooms go for I guess it's what we should have expected--the lobby and website photos are deceiving--the lobby is gorgeous and has been recently renovated, but the rooms are sub-par. Yeah, you get a lot of space and a kitchenette, but at what price? I found the room to be dated, a little dirty and not what I expected. The staff is also extremely rude. Do yourself a favour and slurge down the street at the Sutton place, or check out the Burrard Motor Inn for bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Good prices but doesn't quite meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: TRL1978
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights in this hotel at the end of November. We paid $99 for a Corporate King Suite, which includes a small kitchenette and internet access on the 27th floor. The room was nice, clean, large and had a comfortable bed. Water pressure was good but the temperature of the shower was extremely variable. Although it is sold as a working room, the lighting is dismal, and you can really only work until sundown before straining your eyes. For the internet you might have to rummage for the port, our was hidden behind a chest. The only really negative experience was the parking. We asked if we could leave our car in the hotel car park for the afternoon after we checked out, and we were told of course, but the receptionist failed to mention that we would be charged an extortionate $15 for the 3.5 hrs we parked. Overall, it was a nice hotel, but didn't live up to the expectations it set itself. That said, for $99 it was great value and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: WhitehorseTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time October 13-14, after booking through Expedia at the last minute. The rate was great, and the location on Burrard Street is very convenient to all downtown/West Vancouver shopping and attractions. The room was very comfortable - a small-ish bedroom, but a nicely-sized bathroom, and large living/kitchen area. The kitchen had all amenities. There's a balcony, with an amazing view of downtown and North Shore (had asked for a room on a higher floor, and they were able to accommodate). There's a pool and steam room, and both they and the room have toiletries (lotion, shampoo, conditioner) from the spa that's on the premises. For the price ($119 Cdn/night), I thought it was an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Wants To Be Trendier Than It Is”
Reviews.Author: DanRandom
Reviews.Content: This hotel on Burrard Street in downtown Vancouver is a great place for anyone new to the city. It is walking distance to Yaletown, Granville Island, Gastown, Robson Street, Stanley Park, False Creek, and more. Some walks can be a haul, but there are plenty of busses to help you out. In Sept '06, the hotel was on the tail end of a transformation, and appeared it wanted to be much hipper than it is. The lobby is nice, the room is nice, the hallway corridors are old and small (but who spends time there?). My room (a standard, low-end room), was big with two beds, a couch, a kitchen, and amazing water pressure. The hotel staff was amazingly friendly, but there is no (free) give on the 11am checkout time. The hotel is next to a hotel and YMCA, so there were a few homeless people (not on the hotel property), but they were not obtrusive in any way. As it's the southern end of the city centre business district, there is not much nightlife right at the hotel. But just a few blocks' walk to Robson Street, and you have restaurants, bars, and shops. This was also the least expensive downtown hotel I could find, so I'd consider it a great buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed higher floor”
Reviews.Author: 51mom
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our teenage son and daughter spent three nights at the Century Plaza in late August. Our first two nights were in a one bedroom suite on the seventh floor facing noisy Burrard Street. I could hear people talking on the sidewalk below. Our room had a small living area, kitchenette and private bedroom, but the furniture was dated, the kitchen not very well stocked and we had no air conditioning. The sofabed mattress was thin, but suitable for our teenage son, but too small for two adults. Our teenage daughter slept on an air mattress which we had luckily brought from home. The staff were always friendly and accomodating when we required extra bedding or dishes. I am a light sleeper and was getting tired of the noise on Burrard St. so we decided to ask for an air-conditioned room on a higher floor for our last night. The front desk staff was very accomodating and moved us up to the 29th floor to an airconditioned, renovated room with a jacuzzi tub. The fifty dollar upgrade was worth it just to get the million dollar views of the whole city- English Bay, the mountains and the beautiful sunset. It was a much larger suite with a king size bed, a roomier kitchen, but it still had only one sofabed in the much larger living room. My daughter still slept on the air mattress. We all took turns using the jacuzzi tub which was great! The Century Plaza is a good value for the money if you can stay on the upper floors in an airconditioned, renovated room facing English Bay. The staff was professional, accomodating, and friendly. The Spa staff were also very friendly and took my daughter and I on a full tour of all the spa facilites, just because we asked. Spa prices are typically expensive, but probably worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute crap”
Reviews.Author: truthdweller
Reviews.Content: When we arrived for an overnight stay, the parking garage tipped us off about the quality of the hotel. It's grungy and rundown, and unattended -- as some poor soul discovered on Sunday when their car was broken into. But that's just the beginning. We were three adults. The renovation of the lobby looks nearly complete (and it is really modern and nice), the hotel is a perfect location, and the bar (they told us) had only recently opened. We had good experiences in these areas. The room, though, was pitiful. It looked like a worn out Motel 6. The furniture was stained and worn out. The carpet was bordering on threadbare. The kitchen was completely unstocked with anything. No dishes, utensils or coffee/tea. The cabinets were recently painted over so they looked awful to boot. There was no air conditioning either, and from our floor the air conditioning units on surrounding roofs were loud all night long. We had to ask not once, or twice but FOUR times during an eight hour period to have linens brought up for the sofa bed. The guy at the desk apologized that he "misdelivered the linens to another room." How do you take stuff to the wrong room when they've asked for it FOUR times? Upon unfolding the sofa bed, or attempting to, we discovered it was lashed together with cord. Once we undid the knots, we found out that the frame was broken. Hence, the cord keeping it together. The guy at the front desk then brought up a rollaway cot, which was equally terrible. A thin mattress through which you easily felt the support rod in the frame of the rollaway. He referred us to the manager Angel who would be on duty in the morning. We went down in the morning and she absolutely refused to compensate us, not even a voucher for breakfast in the restaurant. She insisted that the hotel's web site doesn't advertise that the room has a sofa bed (go look: it does), and that we shouldn't have counted on having that available -- even though we reserved the room for THREE adults. Please, don't make assumptions about who is sleeping with whom. We found out the next day, from one of our fellow travelers in another room (who ironically had great service and a good room), that the night manager who should have been on duty the night before to address our issues was actually out at a bar flirting with one of our friends. So much for "on duty"! Later in the day, we went back to talk to her again. She did apologize and said the room was unacceptable, and that she would talk to the owners/managers about how to resolve this. It's two days later and we don't have an answer yet. We didn't sign the credit card receipt either so we can dispute it with Visa. This level of service is abysmal. The staff has an attitude or is inept. The quality of the rooms is pitiful. If you're going to renovate a hotel, then close it down and get it done, and re-open with a staff ready to treat their guests in accordance with the quality of the property you present. Right now, it isn't up to snuff. This hotel is a no-star loser and nothing more. Perhaps once the renovation is complete, and if the staff receives training on how to honor a customer's needs -- or if the ownership of the hotel gets a clue about how to earn business not just suck people's money away -- this would be an awesome place. Until then, management needs to go back to Business 101 and learn how to operate properly.

Reviews.Title: “Forwarned”
Reviews.Author: gmatzner
Reviews.Content: I am a well seasoned traveler who has experienced most levels of lodging, from Days Inn to the Ritz Carltons and from I-95 motels to New York City Luxury. I booked two rooms at the Century Plaza through an internet website at price of C$205 each. When we arrived we were a little concerned that construction was actively going on in the lobby. My wife checked us in before lunch, as I went to pick up our rental car. She said the staff was very courteous and gave us one room on the 18th floor and the second room on the 19th floor which was being cleaned. (They did not have adjoining rooms available as we had requested.) The room was large as advertised, but run down. The carpet was stained and the furniture out of Good Will. The windows were open and there was a nice view. I called down to the front desk to enquire about a better room, but was told that the redone rooms on the top floors were more expensive and they were all booked. After touring Vancouver all day we came back about 11:30pm. As we drove in the garage to park the car we were dismayed to see large graphic signs on every floor indicating that there were “car thieves at work” in the area. As we walked down to enter the rear door on the second level there was a sign that said “locked after 8pm, use front entrance.” However, the door was open and there was no security around, which was disconcerting since anyone could have come in and gotten into the elevator. When we came in the room we closed the windows (because of the city noises) and looked for the thermostat to turn on the air conditioning. After a few minutes we realized to our chagrin there no air conditioning. That’s right, $205 a night and no air conditioning. The front desk said sorry, but no air conditioned rooms were available. I told them to make a note and I would talk to the manager in the morning. Went to speak to the manager in the morning and she apologized profusely. I said I was entitled to an adjustment to the bill. That’s when things went bad. To my amazement she said that air conditioning is was not a listed amenity offered by the hotel. I said you don’t list bathrooms as an amenity either! She must have perfected her act as she had a BS answer for every argument. I then leaned from one of the other guests who were gather around us that about 50 of the 200 rooms have no air conditioning. Then the lady next to me jumped in to the discussion and said she had been stuck in the elevator for 11/2 hours. I was dumbfounded when the manager replied that in her experience it was not unusual for hotel elevators to get stuck, at which point the crowd starting booing her. Clearly the failure to inform guests that some noisy rooms had no air conditioning or that the antiquated elevators frequently break down is not advertised on their website. But, now all of you who read this shall be forewarned

Reviews.Title: “4-night stay”
Reviews.Author: Quickie
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 booked 2 rooms for 4 nights during our trip across western Canada. I was concerned initially because on arrival it is obvious there is refurbishment going on in the reception and lobby area, but in practice we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. As requested the hotel gave us two adjoining rooms on the 20th floor. Positive points were that the rooms were large, bright and comfortable. We had a suite with big bedroom and adjoining lounge and kitchen. The views across this residential area towards English Bay and the mountains were outstanding. There were minor niggleswith the room - no safe for valuables, so had to use a safety deposit at reception, and fairly limited cutlery and cooking utensils varying between rooms - but otherwise great. Air conditioning worked well but despite the heat in Vancouver - over 30 degrees - it was sufficient to open the windows and get the breeze. Points to watch out for are that only two lifts were working some of the time so it can get very busy - as when a youth orchestra was arriving during our stay - and the balcony railings on the 20th floor are much lower than would be allowed in the UK, low waist height. Restaurant gave reasonable value but we only used for breakfast and tended to eat out. In general the staff were very helpful to us with things like booking taxis, maps and directions etc. Would definitely stay again. Location is a strong point on Burrard St, within walking distance of downtown (tourist info, shops, galleries) and in the other direction English Bay, Granville Island. Ask for a room on a higher floor; lower down you won't get the views and might get annoyed with ambulance sirens from the hospital opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and enormous rooms”
Reviews.Author: lucem
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my daughter, her husband and their daughter and stayed here for 5 nights in late April 2006. We were very impressed with the size of our rooms and the facilities in the rooms, including full kitchens. There was plenty of space even with a cot. The pool was good - especially the changing area and showers - the best we saw in Canada. There are plenty of places to shop and eat nearby so we did not use the kitchen much but, with a toddler, it was nice to know it was there if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: letterdude
Reviews.Content: We decided that we wanted to take the family - 2 teenaged boys - to Vancouver for some sightseeing and shopping. No big deal...just a few days to have some fun. We were looking for a budget place that would be roomy, clean and close to downtown. The Century Plaza was fine. After having read the good and poor reviews, we took the time to contact the hotel and reiterate our requests. Of course, they couldn't guarantee the non-smoking, higher level, 2 queen-sized beds, but they said that it was noted and that they'd try. We weren't able to get 2 queens, but the doubles were very comfortable. 23rd floor and no cigarette smoke smell. The staff were all very helpful and efficient. The room really was a 1 bedroom apartment - very spacious. The furniture and appliances are older, but everything works. Downtown core, so we were close to Robson Street shopping, the IMAX, Stanley Park and Gastown. The pool was alright and the sauna was very nice. On the down side. Even on the 23rd floor, you can hear quite a bit of street noise, if your stay involves a Friday/Saturday night. Definitely, bring earplugs. Found it to be pretty quiet, however, during the week. Don't pick this place for romance. Save up a little longer! But, for just treating the family to an outing in the big city, it's ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great from the moment we checked in. Despite arriving at 2 am, we had a bellhop grabbing our bags out of the car and taking us to our suite. The 1 bedroom suite was just like a 1 BR apartment, with a balcony and a great view of the sunset from the 26th floor. We had a problem with the internet connection in the room we were staying in, and on the second day, they upgraded us to the executive suite on the 28th floor, which was significantly larger and had an even better view of the sunset into Burrard inlet and the mountains to the North and West. Both rooms were very comfortable, very clean, lots of windows, great service. We mentioned to some of the staff that we were surprised that the rooms were so nice, since some of the reviews here suggested they were stuffy and old. We were told they recently renovated all of the rooms. While we were there they were performing extensive renovations on the lobby and second floor. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Awful! Stay away from this hotel! ** must read! **”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Worst experience I have EVER have with a hotel, and that is saying a lot! I booked this hotel through expedia and looked at pictures and descriptions and when we walked in, we were so (so so very) disappointed! It was my 3 year anniversary with my spouse. We live just outside Vancouver, and we had saved up money just to spend the weekend away together for something special. First of all, there was major construction going on and there was a really strong smell of paint and drywall and dust. Within 5 minutes of waiting to check in, I already had a headache and was beginning to get an itchy throat and eyes (I have allergies, but they aren't usually very sensitive). We got our room keys and went up to the room. The whole journey to our room smelled terribly of the constuction, and then cigarette smoke. Our room was no better. The smoke smell was disgusting, and there were cigarette burns in the carpets and furniture. I had requested a non smoking because of health problems where smoke gives me a big problem, and this was clearly NOT a non-smoking room. The room was in pretty poor condition, uncomfortable furniture.. a really noisy, irritating fan of some kind. To make matters worse, the smells got a whole lot worse because it became very obvious that at least one of the adjoining rooms were smoking marijuana. By now, I felt completely sick and knew I had to leave. We called expedia and they said that they would refund us for one night, but not the other. In any case, I couldn't stay so I thought we would have to take a loss on the money... which I was pretty upset about because I thought we would just have to turn around and go home, considering we couldn't pay for another hotel stay. When we went down to the front desk (having only been in the room for about half an hour), the woman waiting for us there seemed like she was already ready to fight with us. I told her we weren't upset with her personally, but we were disappointed by expedia. We found out, though, that expedia was willing to refund us ALL our money if the hotel would refund them, and this woman had refused. She was rude, in a word. She refused to try and help us in any way, and was quite hostile towards us for no apparent reason. She was unphased by the fact that I was feeling ill (which was obvious) and that we could not stay there for health reasons. She also acknowledged that she was aware of the drug use going on in the hotel, but did nothing to rectify it. She also refused to provide us with a receipt to show that we did not stay at the hotel for the night. It was only when my spouse when back into the hotel to return a parking pass (for which we were also not refunded) that he saw she had written, seemingly for her own records, "Guest did not stay" that my spouse demanded a copy of. I cannot express how upset I was when we left the hotel. I feel that the manager (who I believe was only "front desk management") could have cooperated with us and expedia and everyone would have been satisfied, but she would not. I do not feel that anyone should be forced to stay in any situation that will affect their health, or subject them to illegal drug use if they object to it. When we left here, a friend took us to the Coast Plaza Hotel and PLEASE, PLEASE read my review of that hotel if you are going to be staying in Vancouver! They went so far out of their way to make us feel better after our terrible experience, that I am recommending all my friends and family stay there whenever possible! But whatever you do, avoid this hotel. Even if it looks alright, avoid it on the principle that you cannot treat people this way!

Reviews.Title: “5 fabulous nights”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at the Century Plaza with a travel companion for a conference. My stay was fabulous. I was worried after hearing that the lobby was undergoing construction, but I barely even noticed the work being done--it was hidden behind full partitions. The lobby staff were friendly and courteous, they recommended excellent restaurants--three total in fact. So the staff know the area and can direct you based on your needs. While I was talking with the staff I really felt their undivided attention. Our room was almost like an apartment--the "virtual 360 tour" pictures of the rooms don't do the hotel justice. We walked into a hallway, the bath was on the right, the bedroom (2 doubles) was straight ahead. A turn to the left revealed the spacious living room area, and the kitchen. Our room had a balconey facing west, overlooking the city and one of the bays or inlets. I saw a beautiful sunset against the mountains every night. The bathroom was a tad small, one had to close the door in order to use the sink, but it was of small consequence. The hospital is right next door, but I only heard sirens twice while I was there, so it was no big deal. The only other negative was that I had to call multiple times to have an iron and ironing board delivered. I did not visit the restaurant, the spa, or the attached comedy club, but we did order room service one night. The food was delivered promptly, and it was piping hot. The location of the Century Plaza can't be beat--it is in the heart of downtown. There is a full grocery store with organic food and produce two or three blocks from the hotel. This store was very handy since we had a kitchen with utensils in our room. Robson street is just another block or two past the store, and there is a bus stop close by too. The room was excellent, the staff were helpful, and the location was great. Stay here if you can! I paid about 80 dollars American a night, thanks to hotels.com. The Century Plaza far exceeded my expectations, given the price. Overall, I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “what's the fuss??”
Reviews.Author: doomdoom
Reviews.Content: After reading quite a few lukewarm reviews, I was nervous about our reservation at Century Plaza, but it was a good price and we needed the extra room. Well,our suite was fine. OK, so the decor's a little tired, but it was clean, comfortable, spacious, great location and the staff were absurdly friendly and efficient. We got a whole suite for the price of one room most places, PLUS a pool!! Great value, no problems. What's the fuss?

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: cigal
Reviews.Content: Good value for the money- centrally located with a good cafe with excellent service. Rooms are large though under-furnished; I rearrange the furniture to be more appealing and functional during my stay. The fully equipped kitchen is nice. Elevators can be very slow, and room decor needs updating. If you are in town for a getaway, concert, or sporting event you can't go wrong with the price and location. Hoity-toity it ain't, except for the Spa. The spa facilities are excellent and a nice way to be pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: gadflyUk
Reviews.Content: 5 night stay on package tour.Spacious room (with full kitchenette facilities - microwave, giant fridge, coffee maker, hob/oven) on 11th floor (of 30)with mountain/downtown west-facing view providing stupendous sunsets vista. (Ask for a room facing this way .) Huge beds. Warm. Well lit.(The previous report complaining about the TV position appears to have missed the fact that the room TVs are on turntable furniture!)General decore a little worn but by no means tawdry.Large shower/bathroom.Moderate storage room. Pleasant staff although concierge advice not always accurate and lacked some local knowledge. Reasonable, quiet, comfortable bar. Chic restaurant offering limited select a la carte menu but tasteful with nice choice of BC wines- Pinot Noir a good buy. Chirpy hotel breakfast/cafe salon open all day. Near to all down town facilities. One drawback is that an A&E is situated on next block so the occasional (at least two a night)ambulance siren can disturb sleep.Rooms are not double glazed. Compared to UK Vancouver is about 20% more expensive. Terrible Art Gallery, loads of stoned non-agressive homeless wander the streets. Dinner in the revolving harbour tower restaurant at night is a must. Excellent choice of city tours. Some absolutely stunning architecture.Walk as much as you can to see it properly - there are thousands of watering holes of various styles along all routes!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - an enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: netty_in_uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Century Plaza as part of a longer trip/tour so didn't actually choose this hotel, it came as part of the package. The hotel is located approx 5 minute walk from Robson St with all the main shops/restaurants etc. We stayed for 4 nights and didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel but found it to be a nice place to stay. The rooms are incredibly large and comfortable and are complete with a kitchenette. There are 2 food services in the hotel. The Plaza Cafe which we used for breakfast once and a lunchtime snack, was nice, good food and friendly service. Roys Steak and Seafood Restaurant (used it twice) was excellent - very good food and a high standard of service but the price is very reasonable. All of the hotel staff were very friendly and incredibly helpful. The only downside to the hotel is that it is quite noisy - it is right next to a hospital with an emergency department so you do get a lot of sirens through the night but thats the price you pay when you stay in a city. The Century Plaza is a very nice hotel and I would certainly recommend it if you are looking for somewhere to stay in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't imagine there being a worse hotel in vancouver”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Over the years I have been to many hotels, in many cities in many states and provinces, in many countries around the world but have never been motivated to write a review. Century Plaza changed all that. This place is abysmal. After checking in, my wife and I headed up to our 185$ room. The putrid smelling halls carpeted in 20 yr + paisley print led us to our 'suite'. We opened the door to be greeted by a rather spacious, but poorly organized room (where you could see the tv from neither the bed nor the couch) and a new yet equally putrid smell. Doing a quick look around the room we found a half glass of water in the washroom along side a used washcloth, and an expired carton of milk in the fridge (leading culprit for the smell). So, we talked to the front desk, and while we stepped out for a minute the maid was sent up to touch up the room. Fine. The next morning I got up to shower and found something I have never seen, even in the dingiest motel. No shampoo and soap covered in someones hair, covered so that it could have been mistaken for a small rodent. At checkout we were assured, by a seemingly equally appalled staff that we would not be charged for our visit. Two days later, however, we were. The manager was indifferent to our complaint, condescending, possesed no qualities to indicate any experience in operating a business. There are many beautiful hotels in Vancouver, I hope after reading this review that this one should used only after the hotstels put out their no vancany sign. This place should be avoided at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The lobby looked nice upon entering and people were pretty helpful. It was our arrival into the room that was disappointing. We had booked a suite with twin beds in the bedroom. However, what we got instead was a queen bed. When we checked out the sofa bed and opened it up, there was a note on it saying "Broken." Not only that, but to keep the sofabed closed, a metal clothing hanger was used as the clamp. It seemed like an old building. The carpet was old and worn, and looked like it had cigaratte burns all over it. The room smelled like stale smoke. It was nice that there was a kitchenette with a full-sized refrigerator. However, it was old and had lime green on the inside. The price was ok for the location, but I would not stay there for a romantic holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but has issues”
Reviews.Author: rick390
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location in downtown Vancouver. It is within easy walking distance of Robson st. shopping and the skytrain. It has a nice pool but no spa, just a sauna. The on-site cafe is serviceable but after one meal there we ate elsewhere. The rooms have kitchenette facilities and small balconies which provide incredible city views. There is a parking garage on premises for $10. a night. Now for the negatives. When we arrived late on a very warm August night we went to our one bedroom suite to find that we had a room with no air conditioning. Two large fans helped but it was still unacceptably warm. A call to the front desk resulted in a change the next day to an air conditioned room. However we should have been given the air conditioned one in the first place as we were able to move into one the first thing the next morning so it had been available when we first arrived. Even in the air conditioned room things were still not so great. The air conditioning unit was located in the living room and only provided adequate cooling in that room, the bedroom only received an inadequate amount of spillover from the livingroom and that was if you kept the bedroom door open to allow the cool air to come in. Also noise from the streets pervaded every inch of the room which prevented us from having a peaceful night's sleep. All in all I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Emma1110
Reviews.Content: We had one of the recently refurbished rooms on the 27th floor, the room was great it had an office, huge comfy bed and a small dining & kitchen area. The view was excellent as well. The cafe on the Ground floor was lovelly - the best breakfasts on our whole trip! The spa is supposed to be one of the best in town - although i didnt try it. There is a guest laundry room on the 5th floor which costs $2 which was muched needed after our cruise. Rays seafood & Grill is ok but there isnt much on the menu. I thought this was a great place and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Drive straight past!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel by my company. I actually stayed for about 3 hours in total. My advice is to save your money and go to another hotel. Rooms were old & smelly. All you could smell was cooking fat/grease in the rooms. I was shown two rooms. The first one smelt so bad!!!! The second smelt, but not as bad due to the windows being open - however extremely noisy & dusty. There are much better hotels in Vancouver!!

Reviews.Title: “Location was the only plus here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for our 10 year anniversary get-away in Feb 05. After a long day of flying we got to our room only to find 2 twin beds (real romantic, huh?). I called to see about getting another room but told we couldn't (something about booking on-line and being full up). They offered to push the beds together and supply new sheets but then never showed up to do so. We made due and pushed them together ourselves. The 11th floor room smelled musty and was a bit hot (even for a zero degree day in February!) but the view was good and location was nice and central to just about everything downtown. Next time we'll probably spend a bit more and stay somewhere down the street.

Reviews.Title: “spacious, but noisy and smelt like burnt and forgotten cooking”
Reviews.Author: snowBoardBunny
Reviews.Content: I called them last minute to get a room and they easily accomodated me which i am very grateful for since no other 2-star plus in downtown vancouver would take me at the time. It was the first week in October 2004 and the downtown hotels were booked solid with business travellers. This hotel boasts the most famous spa in Vancouver and has actually had the likes of Jennifer Lopez as one of it's clientele. From the outside, the hotel looks like it's trapped in the 70's, but inside it's not bad. The elevator's are kind of on the small side, but otherwise, the rooms are very spacious for what you're paying. I had a double bedroom suite complete with full kitchen and basic kitchenware, as well as fridge and table and chairs. There was also a pull out sofabed and balcony. The bathroom needed updating, but apparently, next week was the renovation week for my floor and empty rooms were being prepped for work. It looked it, as the lights and some electrical plugs were loose or missing the plates. Also, I think someone burnt something on the stoves a few days back becuase the entire hallway (I think I was on the 10th floor) smelt of burned food the entire time I was there. It wasn't overwhelming, but definitely, it was a smell that i could have done without. Best things I liked: size of room, ethernet connection, abundance of side tables and kitchenette. I also like the large driveway which allowed for easy pickups and dropoffs from all cars coming to pick me up/drop me off. Service was great at the front desk. Things that could be better: the sound-proofness of the rooms, the security on the balcony doors, the tiling in the bathrooms. Also, the Yuk Yuk's is attached, so it's convenient if you like comedy.

HotelInfo.Name: Century Plaza Hotel and Spa
HotelInfo.Address: 1015 Burrard St., Vancouver, British Columbia V6Z 1Y5, Canada
